commit_message:
Add DriverFactory

This patch create a new class called DriverFactory that will be used to
manage the loaded drivers in Ironic. Before the list of loaded drivers
existed only inside the NodeManager class making it difficult to get
any information about the drivers outside that class.

Change-Id: I56a89dab6ed8f323dcc335c9921f7d0edec634ec

commit_message:
Allow plugins to be specified as a cloud_backend.

Change the cloud_backend module to be specified
when the client class needs to be initialized
rather than when clients.py is imported.

Change-Id: Iec669f9fd52e88e8f2e0fd78380c0b27e87488c9
Implements: blueprint cloud-backend-plugins

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-21 19:33:37.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_glance-install.xml'], 'message': 'Use GLANCE_PASS as keystone password

According to
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Conventions#Install_Guide
it should be GLANCE_PASS for keystone, and GLANCE_DBPASS for mysql. The
guide uses GLANCE_DBPASS for both - fix this.

backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1242860
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Use GLANCE_PASS as keystone password

According to
https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Conventions#Install_Guide
it should be GLANCE_PASS for keystone, and GLANCE_DBPASS for mysql. The
guide uses GLANCE_DBPASS for both - fix this.

Change-Id: I2db43d383db52bfe50bd988a3b30b848b2d7b1ce
backport: havana
Closes-Bug: #1242860

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-17 22:56:38.000000000', 'files': ['ironicclient/common/utils.py'], 'message': 'Sort the dict iterms

commit_message:
Sort the dict iterms

In Python 3.3, hash randomization is enabled by default. It causes the
iteration order of dicts and sets to be unpredictable and differ
across Python runs.

Partial implement: blueprint py33-support

Change-Id: I739bd9ee1cc10dc01d28efb9a4d2b840bc374d63

subject: Raise an error if module import fails!
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-18 15:33:08.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Raise an error if module import fails.

Previously a missing module would cause the config file generator
to pass (mostly) silently with only a small message going to
stdout. If we can't import a module that seems like it is a bad
thing so lets just bail.

Change-Id: I391220e1344ba1785bf04654c7c5f52e2e8e82fc
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-18 15:42:09.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/config/generator.py'], 'message': "Raise an error if module import fails!

Previously a missing module would cause the config file generator
to pass (mostly) silently with only a small message going to
stdout. If we can't import a module that seems like it is a bad
thing so lets just bail.

Change-Id: I391220e1344ba1785bf04654c7c5f52e2e8e82fc
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Raise an error if module import fails!

Previously a missing module would cause the config file generator
to pass (mostly) silently with only a small message going to
stdout. If we can't import a module that seems like it is a bad
thing so lets just bail.

Change-Id: I391220e1344ba1785bf04654c7c5f52e2e8e82fc

Add granularity option to purge_deleted

Allow users to choose how many days, hours, minutes, or seconds to preserve
deleted data.

Updates the generate_samples.sh script so that we remove
.pyc files in the nova source tree before generating the sample file.

If you don't run unit tests the .pyc files won't get regenerated.
This can cause cryptic errors if you run tests, switch branches,
and then try to regenerate your config files if there are module
differences, etc.

Change-Id: I784a22c1cd7fb2c69ea1d9e02f87bd7da19d76aa
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove .pyc files before generating sample conf.

Updates the generate_samples.sh script so that we remove
.pyc files in the nova source tree before generating the sample file.

If you don't run unit tests the .pyc files won't get regenerated.
This can cause cryptic errors if you run tests, switch branches,
and then try to regenerate your config files if there are module
differences, etc.

Change-Id: I784a22c1cd7fb2c69ea1d9e02f87bd7da19d76aa

subject: Move db_sync into the sqlalchemy DB api.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-21 15:10:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Move db_sync into the sqlalchemy DB api.

heat-manage db_sync is currently broken because
heat is trying to use two backends with the Oslo DB
api which is configurable via heat.conf where only
a single DB api can be specified.

Currently this defaults to:

 #The backend to use for db (string value)
 #db_backend=heat.db.sqlalchemy.api

To fix things we:

1) merge heat/db/migration.py into heat/db/api.py.

2) Add db_sync and db_version calls to heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
  which call into the functions in heat/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py.

3) Remove the old heat/db/migration.py module (no longer needed).

In the process we also move the INIT_VERSION constant into
heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py where it is actually used
anyway. (it probably shouldn't have been in the higher level
migration module to begin with)

This should fix SmokeStack which stopped working last Wednesday
with a05dc4b9cdf348ca1ec414fd505256a6760ad17c

Also,
Closes-bug #1241865

Change-Id: I50d489531056016c762bd3be047e3a129cbee4f8
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-21 15:54:32.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/utils.py', 'heat/db/api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/cmd/manage.py', 'heat/db/migration.py'], 'message': "Move db_sync into the sqlalchemy DB api.

heat-manage db_sync is currently broken because
heat is trying to use two backends with the Oslo DB
api which is configurable via heat.conf where only
a single DB api can be specified.

Currently this defaults to:

 #The backend to use for db (string value)
 #db_backend=heat.db.sqlalchemy.api

1) merge heat/db/migration.py into heat/db/api.py.

2) Add db_sync and db_version calls to heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
  which call into the functions in heat/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py.

3) Remove the old heat/db/migration.py module (no longer needed).

In the process we also move the INIT_VERSION constant into
heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py where it is actually used
anyway. (it probably shouldn't have been in the higher level
migration module to begin with)

This should fix SmokeStack which stopped working last Wednesday
with a05dc4b9cdf348ca1ec414fd505256a6760ad17c

Change-Id: I50d489531056016c762bd3be047e3a129cbee4f8
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Move db_sync into the sqlalchemy DB api.

heat-manage db_sync is currently broken because
heat is trying to use two backends with the Oslo DB
api which is configurable via heat.conf where only
a single DB api can be specified.

Currently this defaults to:

 #The backend to use for db (string value)
 #db_backend=heat.db.sqlalchemy.api

To fix things we:

1) merge heat/db/migration.py into heat/db/api.py.

2) Add db_sync and db_version calls to heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py
  which call into the functions in heat/db/sqlalchemy/migration.py.

3) Remove the old heat/db/migration.py module (no longer needed).

In the process we also move the INIT_VERSION constant into
heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py where it is actually used
anyway. (it probably shouldn't have been in the higher level
migration module to begin with)

This should fix SmokeStack which stopped working last Wednesday
with a05dc4b9cdf348ca1ec414fd505256a6760ad17c

Also,
Closes-bug #1241865

Change-Id: I50d489531056016c762bd3be047e3a129cbee4f8

commit_message:
VMware: bug fix for host disk usage

The disk usage ignored the configured datastore_regex. This
could result in the incorrect datastore disk stats being reported.

Change-Id: Icc3fdf9f8dbf1dcb1984220536551b7a396a4f0b
Close-Bug: #1242638

commit_message:
Set LOGOUT_URL properly in horizon settings

LOGOUT_URL depends on the root_path just like LOGIN_URL was is already set in
the template.

Without this change, a user whose session timeouts was redirected to
/auth/logout (404 error) instead of /horizon/auth/logout.

Change-Id: I4f7c7ab4d20eed514c48d79d78980d7415d70be5

commit_message:
Move LockFixture into a fixtures module

In Nova and other projects, fixtures are in test-requirements.txt and
NOT in requirements.txt so updating nova to use latest lockutils.py
is not possible. So let us move LockFixture out into it a separate
fixtures.py module where in theory we can add other fixtures as
well. See https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52153/ for an attempt to
try latest lockutils.py in Nova.

Change-Id: I12942d6390d06bb889d4145e708692fa886d99b5

commit_message:
Update to use LibvirtGenericVIFDriver vif driver

nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtHybridOVSBridgeDriver has been merged
to nova.virt.libvirt.vif.LibvirtGenericVIFDriver by nova commit
3f513aa1e408f762867d9cd7c64ffde68f960437, and it's deprecated since
Grizzly. To simplify configration, we should update to use the new
generic VIF driver.

Change-Id: Ibb8e94c657e1017a29426fce672a00a02d1bd5ba

commit_message:
Fix generate conf script can't handle multistropt

In case MultiStrOpt option's value is empty list, current extract_opts.py
logic will ignore it. This patch aims to update func _print_opt:

add the multistropt's option_name in conf even its value is empty list.

This bug also affects https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1240783

Closes-bug: #1241348

Change-Id: Ica1da0cd20c97a587964cb0059836d609a440145

commit_message:
Improve the default logging configuration

Using the suggested logging configuration, messages were being lost
including serious exceptions, due to the 'django' logger not being
defined.

This brings local_settings.py in line with the upstream changes to
resolve this, and also adds a formatter to make the log message format
more consistent with other projects.

Change-Id: I13ea88602575196681e2ed6f0e5cea2cca8fddd6
Related-Bug: #1236423

commit_message:
Switch from signing/format --> token/provider.

Keystone Havana has now deprecated the old signing format config
file format. It now uses token/provider instead.

token_format is now deprecated.

Closes-Bug #1223265

Change-Id: Ia7c089b51823ad2a559a435b08dfca7364de2979

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-09-30 14:59:45.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add missing __init__.py file

Change-Id: I5140fa62dc8bdd10a58bd2847b27514a926e3c19
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-21 13:06:53.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini', 'tests/__init__.py', 'tests/test_version.py', 'oslo/version/__init__.py'], 'message': "Make the tests actually run

Firstly, add a missing oslo/version/__init__.py.

Secondly, move tests from oslo/version/tests/ to tests/

Having the tests under oslo.version and using oslo.sphinx in the same
virtual env doesn't seem to work. The issue appears to be that because
the tests don't get installed under the namespace package in the venv's
site-packages, testr can't find them.

Personally, I'm a fan of keeping tests in a different directory from the
runtime code and this is what works for oslo.config and oslo.messaging.

Thirdly, avoid using 'setup.py develop' with tox.

There seems to be an issue with the 'setup.py develop' approach caused
by the fact that oslo is a namespace package and we install oslo.sphinx
into this namespace in the virtualenv. This results in the oslo.version
package not being found when it's not properly installed into the
virtualenv.

These really should be three separate commits, but any one of them alone
causes testr to stop pretending everything is fine so they all need to
be merged together.

Closes-Bug: #1242614
Change-Id: I5140fa62dc8bdd10a58bd2847b27514a926e3c19
", 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Make the tests actually run

Firstly, add a missing oslo/version/__init__.py.

Secondly, move tests from oslo/version/tests/ to tests/

Having the tests under oslo.version and using oslo.sphinx in the same
virtual env doesn't seem to work. The issue appears to be that because
the tests don't get installed under the namespace package in the venv's
site-packages, testr can't find them.

Personally, I'm a fan of keeping tests in a different directory from the
runtime code and this is what works for oslo.config and oslo.messaging.

Thirdly, avoid using 'setup.py develop' with tox.

There seems to be an issue with the 'setup.py develop' approach caused
by the fact that oslo is a namespace package and we install oslo.sphinx
into this namespace in the virtualenv. This results in the oslo.version
package not being found when it's not properly installed into the
virtualenv.

These really should be three separate commits, but any one of them alone
causes testr to stop pretending everything is fine so they all need to
be merged together.

Closes-Bug: #1242614
Change-Id: I5140fa62dc8bdd10a58bd2847b27514a926e3c19

subject: Use multiprocessing.Event to ensure services have started
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 15:21:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use multiprocessing.Event to ensure services have started

ServiceRestartTest.test_terminate_sigterm would often fail in my Jenkins
instance. It turns out that sometimes the test case would manage to send
its SIGTERM after the signal handler is put in place, but before we
enter the "try: except" block in _wait_for_exit_or_signal. This meant
that the SignalExit exception isn't caught and makes the process
terminate with non-zero exit code. To verify this, you can add a
time.sleep(3) right after self.handle_signal().

To avoid this race condition, we introduce a Threading.Event compatible
object (from multiprocessing to work across process boundaries) that is
set when entering the try-catch block. This also replaces the
questionable call to "ps".

Change-Id: I598e8bc889b6c2627a62271627d17b44e01acbe4
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-17 22:31:23.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Use multiprocessing.Event to ensure services have started

ServiceRestartTest.test_terminate_sigterm would often fail in my Jenkins
instance. It turns out that sometimes the test case would manage to send
its SIGTERM after the signal handler is put in place, but before we
enter the "try: except" block in _wait_for_exit_or_signal. This meant
that the SignalExit exception isn't caught and makes the process
terminate with non-zero exit code. To verify this, you can add a
time.sleep(3) right after self.handle_signal().

To avoid this race condition, we introduce a Threading.Event compatible
object (from multiprocessing to work across process boundaries) that is
set when entering the try-catch block. This also replaces the
questionable call to "ps".

Change-Id: I598e8bc889b6c2627a62271627d17b44e01acbe4
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-18 21:02:26.000000000', 'files': ['tests/unit/test_service.py', 'openstack/common/service.py'], 'message': 'Use multiprocessing.Event to ensure services have started

ServiceRestartTest.test_terminate_sigterm would often fail in my Jenkins
instance. It turns out that sometimes the test case would manage to send
its SIGTERM after the signal handler is put in place, but before we
enter the "try: except" block in _wait_for_exit_or_signal. This meant
that the SignalExit exception isn't caught and makes the process
terminate with non-zero exit code. To verify this, you can add a
time.sleep(3) right after self.handle_signal().

To avoid this race condition, we add a ready_callback argument to
Service.wait() that gets called when entering the try-catch block.
In the test, we pass an Event object and wait for it to be set before
proceeding. This also gets rid of the questionable call to "ps".

Change-Id: I598e8bc889b6c2627a62271627d17b44e01acbe4
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Use multiprocessing.Event to ensure services have started

ServiceRestartTest.test_terminate_sigterm would often fail in my Jenkins
instance. It turns out that sometimes the test case would manage to send
its SIGTERM after the signal handler is put in place, but before we
enter the "try: except" block in _wait_for_exit_or_signal. This meant
that the SignalExit exception isn't caught and makes the process
terminate with non-zero exit code. To verify this, you can add a
time.sleep(3) right after self.handle_signal().

To avoid this race condition, we add a ready_callback argument to
Service.wait() that gets called when entering the try-catch block.
In the test, we pass an Event object and wait for it to be set before
proceeding. This also gets rid of the questionable call to "ps".

Change-Id: I598e8bc889b6c2627a62271627d17b44e01acbe4

subject: VMWare: Disabling linked clone doesn't cache images
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-09 09:19:26.000000000', 'files': ['nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py', 'nova/tests/test_vmwareapi.py'], 'message': "VMWare: Disabling linked clone doesn't cache images

This fixes an issue when use_linked_clone is false and the image is
already in the cache.  The problem was that the image would be
copied from glance into the instance directory even if it was already
in the cache.  This change checks if the file is in the cache, only
copies from glance if it is not, and copies the image from the cache
into the instance directory if use_linked_clone is false.

Fixes: bug #1207064
(cherry picked from commit c53b0f66802ed82fea8c637f0138c0a01e159efa)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I635e00448fc014b3841ed43b590d451305e8ff2f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
VMWare: Disabling linked clone doesn't cache images

This fixes an issue when use_linked_clone is false and the image is
already in the cache.  The problem was that the image would be
copied from glance into the instance directory even if it was already
in the cache.  This change checks if the file is in the cache, only
copies from glance if it is not, and copies the image from the cache
into the instance directory if use_linked_clone is false.

Fixes: bug #1207064
(cherry picked from commit c53b0f66802ed82fea8c637f0138c0a01e159efa)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I635e00448fc014b3841ed43b590d451305e8ff2f

commit_message:
Fix server action tests for V3 API

On Nova V3 API, the attribute names are changed from CamelCase to
camel_case. This patch fixes server action tests for applying the
name changes.

Partially implements bp nova-v3-api

Change-Id: Ic08b54778431785374c884612d4448204c23e79a

The code would not configure the root disk size to that specified
in the flavor. This was always the size of the glance image.

Fixes bug: 1226052

(cherry picked from commit f0a9b31d90532dd278c12572767c3874648dcaec)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
VMware: Fix bug for root disk size

The code would not configure the root disk size to that specified
in the flavor. This was always the size of the glance image.

Fixes bug: 1226052

(cherry picked from commit f0a9b31d90532dd278c12572767c3874648dcaec)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: Ifc41e6f5bf95c17bac6ab26e9c08aa28d0325bcd

subject: VMwareVCDriver Fix sparse disk copy error on spawn
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-04 21:36:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "VMwareVCDriver Fix sparse disk copy error on spawn

The same approach of calling VirtualDiskManager.CopyVirtualDisk
without destination disk spec in the cluster driver for fixing 1184807
turns out to work for copying a sparse disk as well because vCenter's behavior
for specless copy is to do the reasonable thing of converting a sparse disk to
thin-provisioned, and a flat disk to preallocated.

Tests done:

Verified using tempest that sparse/thin/preallocated image types deploys
properly through the cluster driver. Tempest output to be included in
the review comments.

Fixes bug 1171226

(cherry picked from commit 42e929e990c7d5c4484c05bc92e57f64ca85629e)

commit_message:
VMwareVCDriver Fix sparse disk copy error on spawn

The same approach of calling VirtualDiskManager.CopyVirtualDisk
without destination disk spec in the cluster driver for fixing 1184807
turns out to work for copying a sparse disk as well because vCenter's behavior
for specless copy is to do the reasonable thing of converting a sparse disk to
thin-provisioned, and a flat disk to preallocated.

Tests done:

Verified using tempest that sparse/thin/preallocated image types deploys
properly through the cluster driver. Tempest output to be included in
the review comments.

Fixes bug 1171226

(cherry picked from commit 42e929e990c7d5c4484c05bc92e57f64ca85629e)

Conflicts:

	nova/tests/virt/vmwareapi/test_vmwareapi.py
	nova/virt/vmwareapi/vmops.py

Change-Id: I51627ddb4b9df8cf80f0b9c6efe68ec9eb68cd99

commit_message:
Catch all yaml exceptions

Instead of catching 2 specific exceptions, rather catch the generic
YAMLError as the documentation suggests:
http://pyyaml.org/wiki/PyYAMLDocumentation#YAMLError

Closes-bug: #1242155
Change-Id: I840d5eccafcc576d7a0022d81e5bc50af2d77803

commit_message:
Fixes datastore selection bug

Currently the vmwareapi drivers will only select the first
available datastore it finds, even when there are other
datastores with capacity, it will fill one datastore completely
and then die.

Closes-bug: 1227825

Change-Id: I24f85114ea3f014950c27c0c91a6be352990d263
(cherry picked from commit 6c4b89a2ad51f92707acc01908b63bc507ad8fe7)

subject: Improve external auth (REMOTE_USER) plugin support
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-15 08:35:48.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/common/config.py', 'keystone/auth/plugins/external.py', 'keystone/tests/auth_plugin_external_deprecated.conf', 'doc/source/configuration.rst', 'doc/source/external-auth.rst', 'keystone/tests/test_v3_auth.py'], 'message': 'Improve external auth (REMOTE_USER) plugin support

 - Introduce a new plugin (ExternalDeprecatedGrizzly) to mimic the
   behaviour of the external authentication in Grizzly.

 - In ExternalDefault, do not split REMOTE_USER by "@". Since this will
   cause errors for remote users containing an "@".

   When using the ExternalDefault plugin, the current code splits the
   REMOTE_USER variable by the "@". This is ok if we are using domains
   (i.e. ExternalDomain) since any WSGI middleware must append the
   domain to the username. However, in ExternalDefault the code also
   splits the domain by the "@", even though there should be no domain
   there. ExternalDefault should not split the username at all even if
   it contains an "@".

Partial-Bug: #1211233
DocImpact: Document the three plugins and also reflect the semantics of
the REMOTE_USER variable for the WSGI filters.

Change-Id: I1b2521a526fa976146dfe2fcf4d4c1851416d8ae
(cherry picked from commit 99982e0f7bda5e52d38e6f5c821d9ac527e98327)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Improve external auth (REMOTE_USER) plugin support

 - Introduce a new plugin (ExternalDeprecatedGrizzly) to mimic the
   behaviour of the external authentication in Grizzly.

 - In ExternalDefault, do not split REMOTE_USER by "@". Since this will
   cause errors for remote users containing an "@".

   When using the ExternalDefault plugin, the current code splits the
   REMOTE_USER variable by the "@". This is ok if we are using domains
   (i.e. ExternalDomain) since any WSGI middleware must append the
   domain to the username. However, in ExternalDefault the code also
   splits the domain by the "@", even though there should be no domain
   there. ExternalDefault should not split the username at all even if
   it contains an "@".

Partial-Bug: #1211233
DocImpact: Document the three plugins and also reflect the semantics of
the REMOTE_USER variable for the WSGI filters.

Change-Id: I1b2521a526fa976146dfe2fcf4d4c1851416d8ae
(cherry picked from commit 99982e0f7bda5e52d38e6f5c821d9ac527e98327)

commit_message:

The nested stack resource should accept a number as a string
for TimeoutInMinutes.
The actual fix has been fixed by: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52564/
but this just proves it.

commit_message:
Instances sorted by historical creation timestamp

By default now instances come ordered by their historical time of
creation. Implemented into Nova API, the relevant function is also
extended to accomodate fine-tuning of this order.
Relevant tests added.
Tests mock data amended to allow for historical ordering.
Note, In my opinion table field name Uptime is misleading as it
accomodates data with 'time since creation' nature - a subtle
nuance.

Change-Id: Ifc5e880bbb6e7b8a39f0d093b79b6308bc6e1566
Closes-Bug: #1222286

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-07-30 17:52:37.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Disassociate fixed IPs not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Icc022ea2fb7af08fb7354e3a49c77ad5ae58f34c

commit_message:
Disassociate fixed IPs not known to dnsmasq

Currently, fix_ip disassociation only happens in release_fixed_ip(),
which is called by dhcp-bridge script when ip is released. But there
are circumstances when instancs fail to get lease from dnsmasq(instances
fail to boot or instances fail to spawn). In such case, DHCPRELEASE
packet sent to dnsmasq would never trigger dhcp-bridge to run. Thus the
fixed ip would not be disassociated from instance until
_disassociate_stale_fixed_ips() begins to run.

Actually, this patch borrows the idea from Vishvananda's
3f6739e2a8acdf20d01c0b5039a33f26d879587b commit: explicitly disassociate
fixed ip which is not known to dnsmasq, instead of via the dhcp-release
script.

Steps to reproduce:
1. Create an instance which doesn't send dhcp request to dnsmasq.
2. Delete the instance.
3. The fixed ip associated with the instance is not returned to pool.

Bug 1180766

Change-Id: Icc022ea2fb7af08fb7354e3a49c77ad5ae58f34c
(cherry picked from commit 383ca6cf5ff9172a43339dbf845245fbdf2f8210)

revisions:

There is already the utcnow_ts() function however it rounds down to an
integer number of seconds. For some crypto work we need microsecond
epoch time like the time.time() function provides. For testing it would
be useful to allow this to be overridden like utcnow().

Change-Id: I6ecfc0ffc0f1acc4a46cd477f23c10ae2b101744
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add an overridable version of time.time()

There is already the utcnow_ts() function however it rounds down to an
integer number of seconds. For some crypto work we need microsecond
epoch time like the time.time() function provides. For testing it would
be useful to allow this to be overridden like utcnow().

Change-Id: I6ecfc0ffc0f1acc4a46cd477f23c10ae2b101744

commit_message:
generate a token without tenantName or tenantId

Authenticate to generate a token without tenantName or tenantId,the token
is return but unauthorized when using.
When generate a token without tenantName or tenantId should raise
ValidationError exception and do not to generate the token.

Closes-Bug: #1241482

Change-Id: I139115d3dfaa3218b046e3ce4051f9f4a2a67a7f

commit_message:
Skip bad versions of iso8601

0.1.7 is now released (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/iso8601). We
do need to allow folks to use the old 0.1.4 or the new 0.1.7 and
avoid the two bad versions (0.1.5 and 0.1.6)

Change-Id: I13bb96d131b52bab2d951989dcf734a5e071eeb8

When the update is always made at a set interval, the next update could
be called before the previous one has completed. Data inconsistencies
could arise from changes being made out of order in the updates. Move
the code to call the next update to the "complete" function to make sure
the previous call has finished before starting the next one.

Closes-Bug: #1231751
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update DataTables only after previous call is done

When the update is always made at a set interval, the next update could
be called before the previous one has completed. Data inconsistencies
could arise from changes being made out of order in the updates. Move
the code to call the next update to the "complete" function to make sure
the previous call has finished before starting the next one.

Change-Id: I946912a30934e8d25f83fadaef7c2b8b6db269b2
Closes-Bug: #1231751

commit_message:
Avoid discarding precision of metering data

Fixes bug 1241467

Narrow-casting statistical aggregates to int before inserting
into the resource usage line charts had the effect of unnaturally
smoothening the trend. This was especially apparent for meters
defined over a narrow range (such as cpu_util ranging from 0.0%
to 100.0%).

We now maintain floating point precision for these data.

Change-Id: If6141a4f66aa0078d38aa9f53d913aca5684ad94

commit_message:
Updated Neutron Section

I wish I could say that Neutron Installation section is 100% done,
here is the list of things that need to be finished/completed/considered:

1. Need someone to proof read it once.
2. Add sections for other OpenStack Neutron Plugins, only OVS is
covered over here.
3. Need to review the design of the Networking Section, I think it
can be presented better than it is as of now, as its pretty much
confusing to jump through various modes/types of installation
related to networking section(s).

Backport: stable/havana

Change-Id: Icba8970f3e1340b4b84f7b69831fe9f4b2c03384

commit_message:
Add tests when admin set alarm owner to its own

This patch add some tests to cover the case of a admin set
the alarm owner of a combination alarm to its own project-id/user-id
to verify that the admin is not scoped on its project-id.

Change-Id: Id0a8bafc21e91c655db02564335eb1865004c695

subject: Removing rpc communication from db transaction
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 19:16:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/db/extraroute_db.py'], 'message': "Removing rpc communication from db transaction

In a transaction context of ExtraRoute_db_mixin.update_router() was
called super method that uses subtransaction and communication with l3
agent. In case of agent's heartbeat happens while there is running
transaction, update heartbeat in agents table gets stuck in a deadlock.

Closes-Bug: #1211915
Change-Id: I96e6a9d7172d5a0e3e720a81fcd10f04c40aef07
(cherry picked from commit 5becbbec6a686667925f399904cebd97b583c35a)
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Removing rpc communication from db transaction

In a transaction context of ExtraRoute_db_mixin.update_router() was
called super method that uses subtransaction and communication with l3
agent. In case of agent's heartbeat happens while there is running
transaction, update heartbeat in agents table gets stuck in a deadlock.

Closes-Bug: #1211915
Change-Id: I96e6a9d7172d5a0e3e720a81fcd10f04c40aef07
(cherry picked from commit 5becbbec6a686667925f399904cebd97b583c35a)

subject: Revert "Allow non-use of cfg.CONF in securemessage"
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-18 16:43:41.000000000', 'files': ['openstack/common/rpc/securemessage.py'], 'message': 'Revert "Allow non-use of cfg.CONF in securemessage"

This reverts commit 5c71c257e001b16e03ab78be4518736d5256c3bd.

I don't have enough details about why we did this but it is
breaking some things... namely the config file generator
does not work properly when we lazy load/init our config
file groups like this. We could fix the config file
parser so it ignores things in this case... but it seems reasonable
to revert this too...

I hit issues w/ this because I'm trying to add some missing
crypto modules to Nova in:

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52643/

This causes the config file generator to blow up with the following
message:

Unable to find group for option enabled, maybe it's defined twice in the
same group?

Closes-bug #1241720

Change-Id: Ia09bb82cb65aa280d64c5bccaca62e983a6f7a2d
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Revert "Allow non-use of cfg.CONF in securemessage"

This reverts commit 5c71c257e001b16e03ab78be4518736d5256c3bd.

I don't have enough details about why we did this but it is
breaking some things... namely the config file generator
does not work properly when we lazy load/init our config
file groups like this. We could fix the config file
parser so it ignores things in this case... but it seems reasonable
to revert this too...

I hit issues w/ this because I'm trying to add some missing
crypto modules to Nova in:

 https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52643/

This causes the config file generator to blow up with the following
message:

Unable to find group for option enabled, maybe it's defined twice in the
same group?

Closes-bug #1241720

Change-Id: Ia09bb82cb65aa280d64c5bccaca62e983a6f7a2d

subject: Remove .pyc files before generating sample conf!
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-18 15:39:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Remove .pyc files before generating sample conf.

Updates the generate_samples.sh script so that we remove
.pyc files in the nova source tree before generating the sample file.

If you don't run unit tests the .pyc files won't get regenerated.
This can cause cryptic errors if you run tests, switch branches,
and then try to regenerate your config files if there are module
differences, etc.

Change-Id: I784a22c1cd7fb2c69ea1d9e02f87bd7da19d76aa
", 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-18 15:42:25.000000000', 'files': ['tools/config/generate_sample.sh'], 'message': "Remove .pyc files before generating sample conf!

Updates the generate_samples.sh script so that we remove
.pyc files in the nova source tree before generating the sample file.

If you don't run unit tests the .pyc files won't get regenerated.
This can cause cryptic errors if you run tests, switch branches,
and then try to regenerate your config files if there are module
differences, etc.

Change-Id: I784a22c1cd7fb2c69ea1d9e02f87bd7da19d76aa
", 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Remove .pyc files before generating sample conf!

Updates the generate_samples.sh script so that we remove
.pyc files in the nova source tree before generating the sample file.

If you don't run unit tests the .pyc files won't get regenerated.
This can cause cryptic errors if you run tests, switch branches,
and then try to regenerate your config files if there are module
differences, etc.

Change-Id: I784a22c1cd7fb2c69ea1d9e02f87bd7da19d76aa

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-19 22:41:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'skip bad versions of iso8601

0.1.7 is now released (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/iso8601). We

avoid the two bad versions (0.1.5 and 0.1.6)

', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-19 22:42:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Skip bad versions of iso8601

commit_message:
Skip bad versions of iso8601

0.1.7 is now released (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/iso8601). We
do need to allow folks to use the old 0.1.4 or the new  0.1.7 and
avoid the two bad versions (0.1.5 and 0.1.6)

Closes-Bug: 1241460

Change-Id: I96bfd8f27d9f7327c4c353c5f57660aabaa8c735

commit_message:
Add utils.log_task_wrapper() method

This wrapper add before and after method excecution logs messages:

params = {'task': self.task['uuid'], 'msg': msg % kw}

Log _("Task %(task)s start: %(msg)s") % params
Exectue your method
Log _("Task %(task)s finish: %(msg)s) % params

bp logging

Change-Id: Ib07fe5cfd00637c14010cfe5f49cae9fe55f5eaf

Use nova.conf for auth_token configs.

Updates lib/nova so that we use the application config file (nova.conf)
instead of the Nova api-paste.ini config file.

instead of the Cinder api-paste.ini config file.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 16:15:26.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "[PRD-2251] Add more checks to check_networks

Following checks are implemented now (according to PRD-2193):

1) Fuelweb admin network should be assigned to the dedicated interface where no one other network is assigned too.
2) Private network (VLAN mode only) should be assigned to the dedicated interface where no one other network is assigned too.
3) VLANs of Public, Management, Storage shouldn't be intersected to each other or Private VLAN range in VLAN mode.
4) IP addresses ranges of all networks (except Internal network) in cluster shouldn't be intersected to each other.
5) Public gateway and Floating Start and Stop IPs should belong to Public CIDR.
6) -
7) There shouldn't be two or more untagged networks on a single interface.
8) -

Change-Id: Iddeae44dafc580eb93e810b65bc582a5b7b5515f

commit_message:
[PRD-2251] Add more checks to check_networks

Following checks are implemented now (according to PRD-2193):

1) Fuelweb admin network should be assigned to the dedicated interface where no one other network is assigned too.
2) Private network (VLAN mode only) should be assigned to the dedicated interface where no one other network is assigned too.
3) VLANs of Public, Management, Storage shouldn't be intersected to each other or Private VLAN range in VLAN mode.
4) IP addresses ranges of all networks (except Internal network) in cluster shouldn't be intersected to each other.
5) Public gateway and Floating Start and Stop IPs should belong to Public CIDR.
6) -
7) There shouldn't be two or more untagged networks on a single interface.
8) -

Change-Id: Iddeae44dafc580eb93e810b65bc582a5b7b5515f

commit_message:
Enables DB2 server disconnects to be handled pessimistically

A checkout listener can be added to sqlalchemy to be able to
handle database disconnect pessimistically and avoid an error in
the event of a DB restart or simply a temp connection issue due
to network glitches. At the moment only mysql is enabled with
this feature. This patch enables DB2 as well.

Synched from Oslo change I5563360b43c4b648f5b035099b0e1d2e71d32503

Partial-Bug: #1231657

Change-Id: I5502d1de59ae7bcadc830f15caa7ac5ce67b32db

revisions:

Now the value of deleted_at in the notification of
compute.instance.delete.end is empty, the root cause is that compute
api did not set this value when delete instance.

Compute api need to update the value of deleted_at when delete an
instance so as to make sure the field deleted_at is right in the
notification of compute.instance.delete.end.

Change-Id: I0a722ee7f6abc5d9971d1e0046766e6d6c3fcfe8
Closes-Bug: # 1241681
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update field of deleted_at when delete an instance

Now the value of deleted_at in the notification of
compute.instance.delete.end is empty, the root cause is that compute
api did not set this value when delete instance.

Compute api need to update the value of deleted_at when delete an
instance so as to make sure the field deleted_at is right in the
notification of compute.instance.delete.end.

Change-Id: I0a722ee7f6abc5d9971d1e0046766e6d6c3fcfe8
Closes-Bug: # 1241681

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Unpin iso8601 but skip bad versions

0.1.7 is now released (https://pypi.python.org/pypi/iso8601). We
do need to allow folks to use the old 0.1.4 or the new  0.1.7 and
avoid the two bad versions (0.1.5 and 0.1.6)

Change-Id: Ic0784ec0a0d380da1b745a8c335fa4edb865fad8

commit_message:
Get rid of rally.benchmark.tests module

This patch gets rid of the rally.benchmark.tests module, which contained just
the lists of benchmark scenarios and verification tests. Both were moved to
the test engine class as its instance variables.

Blueprint test-engine

Change-Id: I5044ab69db4d3724fcc8319c931f3aac82525778

if interface_mappings is not set.

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-01 18:46:20.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Override endpoint URL check for API version

get_volume_api_version_from_endpoint currently assumes that the
management_url will always be in the format of
http://<ip>:<port>/vX/<tenant_id>. Customers using an IaaS gateway, however,
get a mangement_url in the form of
https://<ip>:<port>/<resource>/vX/<tenant_id>.  This causes the
get_volume_api_version_from_endpoint to find the resource portion of the
url when looking for the Volume API version which makes the
cinder client unusable.

To resolves this I have implemented a check for OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION being
set in the environment.  If the variable is manually set we assume the
user has purposefully set the variable and use it as the os_volume_api_version,
skipping the checking/parsing of the management_url.

There are proposals to fix this via changes to keystone in future releases,
but this provides a way for IaaS Gateway users to proceed with Havana.

Change-Id: I8b978a6ecd87b81c6ae34938e37623ad1cc33994
Closes-Bug: 1233311

There are proposals to fix this via changes to keystone in future releases,

commit_message:
Override endpoint URL check for API version

get_volume_api_version_from_endpoint currently assumes that the
management_url will always be in the format of
http://<ip>:<port>/vX/<tenant_id>. Customers using a gateway, however,
can get a mangement_url in a different form like
https://<ip>:<port>/<resource>/vX/<tenant_id>.  This causes the
get_volume_api_version_from_endpoint to find the resource portion of the
url when looking for the Volume API version which makes the
cinder client unusable.

To resolve this I have implemented an exception handler in the case that
get_volume_api_version_from_endpoint fails.  If the exception is thrown, I
check for OS_VOLUME_API_VERSION in the environment and use the value of that
environment variable, if it is set, to determine the API version to use.

There are proposals to fix this via changes to keystone in future releases,
but this provides a way for IaaS Gateway users to proceed with Havana.

Change-Id: I8b978a6ecd87b81c6ae34938e37623ad1cc33994
Closes-Bug: 1233311

commit_message:
Add error log for SystemExit in dhcp-agent

The SystemExit exception should be logged in dhcp-agent, the
operator may miss the useful exception messages to debug.

* Add error log for SystemExit in dhcp-agent.
* Add addCleanup(mock.patch.stopall) in setup()
* Remove teardown()
* Add unit test for None and nonexistent interface_driver.

Closes-Bug #1239030

Change-Id: I01bef69adecaaf8d8a919034d33c60a43e4469a7

commit_message:
Use "python -m coverage" instead of coverage cli

As requested by the Debian package maintainer, this makes the

Closes-Bug: #1241221

commit_message:
Allow RS LoadBalancer resource to have no nodes

It should be possible to create Rackspace load balancer with no nodes
now. There was an incidental bug in the way that the resource constructed
the node list that would prevent this.

Note that it won't be possible to actually use this to create a nodeless LB
until a new release of pyrax is made, but this change should be harmless enough
to be merged before that.

Change-Id: Icb9b50899cc13094e295280f89090def30cb4155
Closes-Bug: #1241221

commit_message:
Updated Neutron Section

I wish I could say that Neutron Installation section is 100% done,
here is the list of things that need to be finished/completed/considered:

1. Testing ... need another cook to spoil the froth
2. Add sections for other OpenStack Neutron Plugins, only OVS is
   covered over here.
3. Need to review the design of the Networking Section, I think it
   can be presented better than it is rite now, as its pretty much
   confusing to jump through various modes/types of installation
   related to networking section(s).
4. Nova-Networks is (or about to be) deprecated, is it a good idea
   to keep it in focus?

Change-Id: I37863715a8035d26dfa6a7b1679704ac58160166

commit_message:
Added lower version boundary for netaddr

Versions <= 0.7.4 do not support the "version" parameter on
netaddr.IPNetwork() which is used by Ironic (potentially other projects
as well).

Version == 0.7.5 contains a bug (https://github.com/drkjam/netaddr/issues/2)
that affect the GenericUtilsTestCase.test_get_shortened_ipv6_cidr on
Ironic (potentially other projects as well)

So setting the version of netaddr to be >= 0.7.6 should avoid such issues.

Change-Id: I0218a3bb4f17f1a8101d3fa2d3910fb1645470cf
Related-Bug: #1234672

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-18 16:53:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Do not use iso8601-0.1.5

There is a bug in iso8601-0.1.5 that breaks offset parsing.  This
is being fixed upstream, but we never want to use that version of
the package.

Change-Id: I1584ddfc7e08cc94a9aa99ad70b22da4cbd58799
Closes-Bug: 1241460
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-18 18:02:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Do not use iso8601-0.1.5 or 0.1.6

There are bugs in iso8601-0.1.5 and 0.1.6 that break its parsing.
This needs to be fixed upstream, but we never want to use those
versions of the package.

Change-Id: I1584ddfc7e08cc94a9aa99ad70b22da4cbd58799
Related-Bug: 1241460
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-18 22:28:00.000000000', 'files': ['global-requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Pin iso8601 to 0.1.4

Upstream iso8601 is currently broken above 0.1.4, which is
breaking gating in a number of projects.  Pin it until upstream is
fixed.

Change-Id: I1584ddfc7e08cc94a9aa99ad70b22da4cbd58799
Related-Bug: 1241460
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
Pin iso8601 to 0.1.4

Upstream iso8601 is currently broken above 0.1.4, which is
breaking gating in a number of projects.  Pin it until upstream is
fixed.

Change-Id: I1584ddfc7e08cc94a9aa99ad70b22da4cbd58799
Related-Bug: 1241460

commit_message:
Comply with pep440

pep440 indicates that development releases should mark themselves with
the devN specifier.

  http://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0440/#developmental-releases

Instead of using aN as we are currently doing for automatically
generated versions, we should use the pep440 compliant devN form.

Change-Id: Ieeb5149f8b013e76621112593e0a5c0a64817e1f

subject: Move non-heat resources into a new heat stack
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 22:05:36.000000000', 'files': ['heat/engine/parser.py', 'heat/tests/test_event.py', 'heat/engine/resources/template_resource.py', 'heat/engine/resource.py'], 'message': 'Move non-heat resources into a new heat stack

This is second patch in the series to move non-heat resources
into heat stack.
Adding support to bring non-heat resource in to the heat stack
1. Adding base schema to resource.py and this schema can be used
   to provide pre-created/existing resource id
2. Overriding resource properties with environment properties

Blueprint# move-resources-into-heat

Change-Id: Idc9c581d6423cd40f4a6d5808f5aeb4a40013b81
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Move non-heat resources into a new heat stack

This is second patch in the series to move non-heat resources
into heat stack.
Adding support to bring non-heat resource in to the heat stack
1. Adding base schema to resource.py and this schema can be used
   to provide pre-created/existing resource id
2. Overriding resource properties with environment properties

Blueprint# move-resources-into-heat

Change-Id: Idc9c581d6423cd40f4a6d5808f5aeb4a40013b81

commit_message:
Evacuate instance to a scheduled host

In the event of a unrecoverable hardware failure, support needs to
relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt. This
API call locates a suitable host within the same
cell (using nova-scheduler), and performs an update of the
instance's location to the new host (similar to a rebuild). This
call is only available to users with the Admin role.

Compute api calls the conductor. conductor used scheduler to select
destination.
DocImpact

Change-Id: Idb0869c1b7571be0cc136e6588aeffc61d987ab7
Implements: blueprint find-host-and-evacuate-instance

commit_message:
WIP: Adding inital server pools implementation

Adding barebones implementation of server pools. Moved the server
resource to be a sub resource of pools in the v2 API, and created a
pool-manager-agent that controls the backend for that pool

Change-Id: I891671b8028ae1d3a1d5f4def5027f3debcec20b
Implements: blueprint initial-server-pools

subject: Middleware module for container forwarding.
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-11 15:46:55.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Middleware module for container forwarding.

This is one of a set of patches implementing a container-forwarding feature.
(see https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/cluster-federation)

This middleware enables a container to be forwarded to another
cluster i.e. the container exists within the account on a
first cluster but its contents are stored in a container
on another cluster. Forwarding policy is controlled by
middleware config, and a client/user is not aware of a
container being forwarded.

The patch also makes a small number of changes to proxy
modules which provide callbacks to the middleware during
request processing. These enable the middleware to modify
request handling when necessary.

blueprint cluster-federation

commit_message:
Middleware module for container forwarding.

This is one of a set of patches implementing a container-forwarding feature.
(see https://blueprints.launchpad.net/swift/+spec/cluster-federation)

This middleware enables a container to be forwarded to another
cluster i.e. the container exists within the account on a
first cluster but its contents are stored in a container
on another cluster. Forwarding policy is controlled by
middleware config, and a client/user is not aware of a
container being forwarded.

The patch also makes a small number of changes to proxy
modules which provide callbacks to the middleware during
request processing. These enable the middleware to modify
request handling when necessary.

depends on https://review.openstack.org/51228
depends on https://review.openstack.org/51242

blueprint cluster-federation

Change-Id: I27b5ff8bd046990f60dce6e0b97a5b7eea0eef4c

commit_message:
Address UnboundLocalError while deleting instance

This patch deal with the problem with minimal impact.

Ideally the issue could be addressed by ensuring
that neutron returned more than just network id's
but this would require more work than it's worth
for this specific case.

Fixes bug #1227337

Change-Id: Ia5cec2067b6ef7ccffa01c354794954d2282c1cf

commit_message:
only insert display level header if the file supports it

we were previously supporting the display level header on all files
we touched. However if the file doesn't support display level we
shouldn't confuse the user by presenting it.

Change-Id: Ifad129eb676a13e5fb590efce1d592d14c519570

commit_message:
Handling security group error when booting an instance

- Handling the error and marking the instance as ERROR
- Not raising the exception so that the quota gets consumed

Fixes bug 1240678

Change-Id: I53c0b2eec1ef4763ecf973f2a54dda4a09064e46

commit_message:
Make ROOTDIR determination more robust

Determine ROOTDIR without using $PWD and also handle the
case where keystone/ is a symlink to a different directory
hierarchy.

Fixes-Bug: #1241198
Change-Id: I649da899c1425ffe933f2bb0faa53bfb0d999f3d

commit_message:
enhance swiftclient logging

* log to debug for successes and info for errors
* remove dead code, neither body or raw_body are sent in kwargs
* include resp.reason and response headers in logging
* remove trailing \n in logging. users who want them can set logging.basicConfig(format=FORMAT)
* add --info option to swift cli

Change-Id: If07af46cb377f3f3d70f6c4284037241d360a8b7

subject: fix(bootstrap): Logging CLI options don't work
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 21:12:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fix(bootstrap): Logging CLI options don't work

In the current implementation, Bootstrap creates the config option
inside its initializer. That means that common options such as
those registered by openstack.common.log, are not registered.

This patch modifies the Bootstrap initializer to take a config
instance from the caller, rather than trying to build one
itself. This does two things for us:

1. Avoids "magic" marconi configuration; the caller has full
   control and visibility into how marconi is configured.
2. Allows for passing in the global CONF object from the
   marconi-server command and the reference WSGI app module
   so that common options registered by oslo modules on the
   global CONF instance are picked up.

Hopefully openstack.common.log will be modified at some point
so that it isn't tightly coupled with cfg.CONF.

Implements: blueprint remove-global-config

commit_message:
fix(bootstrap): Logging CLI options don't work

In the current implementation, Bootstrap creates the config option
inside its initializer. That means that common options such as
those registered by openstack.common.log, are not registered.

This patch modifies the Bootstrap initializer to take a config
instance from the caller, rather than trying to build one
itself. This does two things for us:

1. Avoids "magic" marconi configuration; the caller has full
   control and visibility into how marconi is configured.
2. Allows for passing in the global CONF object from the
   marconi-server command and the reference WSGI app module
   so that common options registered by oslo modules on the
   global CONF instance are picked up.

Hopefully openstack.common.log will be modified at some point
so that it isn't tightly coupled with cfg.CONF.

Implements: blueprint remove-global-config
Change-Id: Ibb6638f99ca2ce4a2a6025f6cd41939bb30fa85a

commit_message:
Storage: restore injected data on resumption

In storage we now use single task for injector (we look it up by name)
and we restore result mapping for that task in constructor if there
is one in flow detail we are given. This has visible effect
of injected data staying in storage after resumption.

Closes-bug: #1240931
Change-Id: I2e8fb2c4b5cca769d36f578a934119db4a530f5c

commit_message:
Fix User ID in Context and Notifications

    Notifications should contain the User ID not the User Name
    This change replaces the deprecated X-User header with
    X-User-Id.  In most cases, the User ID is preferred over the
    name.

Fixes: Bug 1235145
Change-Id: I3cce6b35fc40f4ff4cc45b04714067956fb1864c

subject: Update python-ceilometerclient dependency version to 1.0.6
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 15:55:46.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt'], 'message': 'Update python-ceilometerclient dependency version to 1.0.6

In line with global requirements update in commit:

  15ef59f7b4ca8e040429d3fda0b3b8906ecd1162

Summary of changes in 1.0.6:

  $ git fetch ; git tag -n15 -l 1.0.6

  1.0.6           python-ceilometerclient 1.0.6

    Includes the following changes:

         * Add support for new alarm-history command
         * Use standard CLI object-verb ordering for alarm-{g|s}set-state
         * Fix shell.do_alarm_get_state to get as opposed to set
         * Updated from global requirements
         * Allow to update an alarm partially
         * Added support to --os-cacert
         * Help messages: specify which options are required
         * Improve the CM shell client alarm visualisation

Change-Id: I17e1d0aab46e9409af2ef8e1bec7428acbb19e14
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update python-ceilometerclient dependency version to 1.0.6

In line with global requirements update in commit:

  15ef59f7b4ca8e040429d3fda0b3b8906ecd1162

Summary of changes in 1.0.6:

  $ git fetch ; git tag -n15 -l 1.0.6

  1.0.6           python-ceilometerclient 1.0.6

    Includes the following changes:

         * Add support for new alarm-history command
         * Use standard CLI object-verb ordering for alarm-{g|s}set-state
         * Fix shell.do_alarm_get_state to get as opposed to set
         * Updated from global requirements
         * Allow to update an alarm partially
         * Added support to --os-cacert
         * Help messages: specify which options are required
         * Improve the CM shell client alarm visualisation

Change-Id: I17e1d0aab46e9409af2ef8e1bec7428acbb19e14

commit_message:
Add Unit test framework and provide unittests for DB API

testtools and fixtures for performance improvements compared to unittest
Please use test.py as a base for further unittests

Re: DB API testing, only CRUD lease has been tested, CRUD Reservation
and Event shall be tested too. I will provide another review once I'll
finish the Manager Extension for Host Reservation.

Refactoring previous unittests for using the framework
Rebased requirements

Change-Id: Ia9a187c45e40f891c8478fb234dd021cffadbe03

commit_message:
Allow to use lockutils without fixtures installed

Current version of lockutils unconditionnaly requires fixtures. This is
not good for projects that use lockutils not only for tests but alos in
runtime.

This change provides a way to provide the fixture only if fixtures
module is available.

Change-Id: Ic5b97939075b83956097a8fc017c07a95bba6981

', 'number': 8}, {'created': '2013-10-15 18:31:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Changing floating_id id datatype to VARCHAR(36). It's a fix to the bug https://bugs.launchpad.net/nova/+bug/1078055.
The solution cannot be just an argument validation to accept just numeric values, since neutron API can create
floating IPs with alphanumeric ids.

Change-Id: I71b2304701eea4e64f720d1e759b34e341b3db74
", 'number': 9}, {'created': '2013-10-15 19:04:43.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Changing floating_id id datatype to VARCHAR(36)

I've proposed a solution to this bug where I validate the argument to make sure that the database would receive a numeric value.
Unfortunately this solution doesn't work because the floating ips created using neutron receive alphanumeric ids.
So I changed the column type to varchar (instead of integer) and now the id is generated before some insert using the class uuid.

Closes-bug: #1078055

commit_message:
Changing floating_id id datatype to VARCHAR(36)

I've proposed a solution to this bug where I validate the argument to make sure that the database would receive a numeric value.
Unfortunately this solution doesn't work because the floating ips created using neutron receive alphanumeric ids.
So I changed the column type to varchar (instead of integer) and now the id is generated before some insert using the class uuid.

Closes-bug: #1078055
Change-Id: I71b2304701eea4e64f720d1e759b34e341b3db74

commit_message:
Fail quickly if file injection for boot volume

Previously if the user attempted file injection on a booted volume it
would fail and retry several times, which slowed down the instance
spawning.  Instead of attempting file injection, fail quickly, and
log a warning

Fix bug 1188543

Change-Id: I264540de736c2bcb92567826fe5ba672e1244ba2

commit_message:
Use BaremetalArch parameter instead of sed.

Updates heat stack-create command for the undercloud so that
it makes use of the BaremetalArch parameter. This allows
us to remove the broken sed statement which was trying to
do the same thing (but used the wrong substitution string anyway).

Change-Id: I2dfa238352919cae2a6989112fccf065c0f6aa8c

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 21:02:31.000000000', 'files': ['TESTING.md', 'Vagrantfile'], 'message': 'Removing vagrant-cachier for interfering with debugging

Vagrant-cachier works very well at caching components but should probably not be
part of the default usage because we are frequently testing changes in packages
and cookbooks, the 2 things most likely to be cached and re-used.

Change-Id: I4458bf4806e574abc20e4fb6c3fc68409cd045a0
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Removing vagrant-cachier for interfering with debugging

Vagrant-cachier works very well at caching components but should probably not be
part of the default usage because we are frequently testing changes in packages
and cookbooks, the 2 things most likely to be cached and re-used.

Change-Id: I4458bf4806e574abc20e4fb6c3fc68409cd045a0

commit_message:
Use custom PowerManager for undercloud.

We now support a PowerManager parameter in our undercloud heat
templates. Lets make use of it so that TOCI better supports
real bare metal.

Change-Id: I5fe9ae4fe847bfcba657ce234d477dd685b8c8c5

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-18 14:30:05.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'graceful-shutdown: add graceful shutdown into compute

The following commit brings in oslo-incubator service.py which
includes calls to support graceful shutdown.  The common service
class has changed to handle signals and manage Services.  When
a signal is received the Services are stopped which in turn
waits on all child threads (Proxy callbacks) to complete.

This allows long running commands to complete prior to killing
the process.  This change only works for SIGTERM and SIGINT
signals.

Unit test was added to verify parent stop method is called in
a shutdown condition.

Change-Id: I21a45862f491530523037632fd70c60cc0153c0a

commit_message:
graceful-shutdown: add graceful shutdown into compute

The following commit brings in oslo-incubator service.py which
includes calls to support graceful shutdown.  The common service
class has changed to handle signals and manage Services.  When
a signal is received the Services are stopped which in turn
waits on all child threads (Proxy callbacks) to complete.

The oslo-incubator commit hash that was used to update
nova was b5fba9e40d609d63b4dab9ca351f7e22e9d8b35b.

This allows long running commands to complete prior to killing
the process.  This change only works for SIGTERM and SIGINT
signals.

Unit test was added to verify parent stop method is called in
a shutdown condition.

Change-Id: I21a45862f491530523037632fd70c60cc0153c0a
Implements: blueprint graceful-shutdown

commit_message:
Add a skip for meter-label cli tests

This commit just adds a skip decorator for 2 neutron tests that don't
work in the gate either because of improper test setup or missing
devstack configuration.

Related-Bug: #1240694

Change-Id: I508aaf3dbc49c326cd54e2008f3e14935f23056e

In nova, one would specify a full module path for the rpc_backend.  We
also need to support this in oslo.messaging.  We can do this by simply

", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix get_transport for nova

In nova, one would specify a full module path for the rpc_backend.  We
also need to support this in oslo.messaging.  We can do this by simply
looking for 'rpc.impl_' in rpc_backend and strip off that string and
anything before it.

Change-Id: I068d19a30dadba8c19796635a49cdb6c3c7c9802
Closes-bug: 1241200

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 6159, 'name': 'Flavio Percoco Premoli', 'email': 'fpercoco@redhat.com', 'username': 'flaper87'}, {'_account_id': 6427, 'name': 'Kurt Griffiths', 'email': 'kurt.griffiths@rackspace.com', 'username': 'kgriffs'}, {'_account_id': 6943, 'name': 'Zhihao Yuan', 'email': 'zhihao.yuan@rackspace.com', 'username': 'zyuan'}, {'_account_id': 6944, 'name': 'Allele Dev', 'email': 'cpp.cabrera@gmail.com', 'username': 'cpp-cabrera'}, {'_account_id': 7044, 'name': 'Allan Metts', 'email': 'allan.metts@rackspace.com', 'username': 'ametts'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 18:42:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP

Change-Id: I5190211e81fe4acd311b2cfdd0bae806cc3fec81
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-08 19:53:50.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'WIP: Sharding

Change-Id: I5190211e81fe4acd311b2cfdd0bae806cc3fec81
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-08 23:08:49.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'feat: Storage sharding foundation

This patch provides the plumbing for implementing storage
sharding across multiple backends. Sharding is agnostic to
storage driver type and transport type. The new feature is
optional, and disabled by default.

The design eschews placing any kind of sharding proxy in
the data pipeline, allowing the storage drivers to continue
communicating directly with their respective backends.

Sharding can be enabled by setting a new configuration
option, "sharding", to True. Future patches will add a
sharding section to the config that can be used to tweak
the way sharding works when it is enabled.

When enabled, all storage driver lookups are serviced by
by a new Shard Manager object. The Manager is responsible
for registering and deregistering queues in the shard
catalog, and for looking up an appropriate storage driver,
according to which shard a particular queue has been
assigned.

In the future, this design will make it straightforward to
map individual queues to different storage backends,
according to user preference.

Partially-Implements: blueprint storage-sharding
Change-Id: I5190211e81fe4acd311b2cfdd0bae806cc3fec81
', 'number': 3}, {'created': '2013-10-11 16:16:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'feat: Storage sharding foundation

This patch provides the plumbing for implementing storage
sharding across multiple backends. Sharding is agnostic to
storage driver type and transport type. The new feature is
optional, and disabled by default.

The design eschews placing any kind of sharding reverse proxy
in the network, allowing the storage drivers to continue
communicating directly with their respective backends.

Sharding can be enabled by setting the global "sharding"
option to True. Future patches will add a sharding section to
the config that can be used to tweak the way sharding works when
it is enabled.

Storage drivers are managed by a Catalog class. The Catalog is
responsible for registering and deregistering queues in the
catalog backend, and for looking up an appropriate driver,
according to which shard a particular queue has been assigned.

In the future, this design will make it straightforward to map
individual queues to different storage backends, according to user
preference.

FWIW, I considered enabling sharding by inserting the routing driver
as the last stage in the storage pipeline. However, it felt like
a hack for the following reasons:

    * Doing so orphaned the regular, solitary driver that was
      still always loaded at the end of the pipeline.
    * Since the bootstrap was not aware of the sharding driver,
      it could not be used to provide setup, so the catalog
      object had to be turned into a singleton and options
      had to always be loaded from the global config.
    * The driver would have to be added to each controller
      pipeline, and would have to always be the last stage in
      the pipeline. Introducing a simple "sharded" boolean option
      seemed to be a more straightforward, less error-prone way
      for operators to enable sharding.

Partially-Implements: blueprint storage-sharding
Change-Id: I5190211e81fe4acd311b2cfdd0bae806cc3fec81

commit_message:
feat: Storage sharding foundation

This patch provides the plumbing for implementing storage
sharding across multiple backends. Sharding is agnostic to
storage driver type and transport type. The new feature is
optional, and disabled by default.

The design eschews placing any kind of sharding reverse proxy
in the network, allowing the storage drivers to continue
communicating directly with their respective backends.

Sharding can be enabled by setting the global "sharding"
option to True. Future patches will add a sharding section to
the config that can be used to tweak the way sharding works when
it is enabled.

Storage drivers are managed by a Catalog class. The Catalog is
responsible for registering and deregistering queues in the
catalog backend, and for looking up an appropriate driver,
according to which shard a particular queue has been assigned.

In the future, this design will make it straightforward to map
individual queues to different storage backends, according to user
preference.

FWIW, I considered enabling sharding by inserting the routing driver
as the last stage in the storage pipeline. However, it felt like
a hack for the following reasons:

  * Doing so orphaned the regular, solitary driver that was
    still always loaded at the end of the pipeline.
  * Since the bootstrap was not aware of the sharding driver,
    it could not be used to provide setup, so the catalog
    object had to be turned into a singleton and options
    had to always be loaded from the global config.
  * The driver would have to be added to each controller
    pipeline, and would have to always be the last stage in
    the pipeline. Introducing a simple "sharded" boolean option
    seemed to be a more straightforward, less error-prone way
    for operators to enable sharding.

Partially-Implements: blueprint storage-sharding
Change-Id: I5190211e81fe4acd311b2cfdd0bae806cc3fec81

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-17 05:02:04.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Inject "-tempest-" string to rand_name

In many tempest tests, we use rand_name(). However, these generated
names are very general. So it is difficult to distinguish the resource
is generated from Tempest or not.
And, in many tests, we use rand_name() with '-' suffix such as
rand_name('foo-'). I think this is not smart.
So this commit injects "-tempest-" to rand_name().

And, by this commit, the generated rand name will include "--" such as
'foo--tempest-123'.
So I will fix them in another commit.

Change-Id: I7bb8f5bbe2346b0b0ab6e91757e20a67b9098f8a

commit_message:
Inject "-tempest-" string to rand_name

In many tempest tests, we use rand_name(). However, these generated
names are very general. So it is difficult to distinguish the resource
is generated from Tempest or not.
And, in many tests, we use rand_name() with '-' suffix such as
rand_name('foo-'). I think this is not smart.
So this commit injects "-tempest-" to rand_name().

And, by this commit, the generated rand name will include "--" such as
'foo--tempest-123'.
So I will fix them in another commit.

Change-Id: I7bb8f5bbe2346b0b0ab6e91757e20a67b9098f8a

reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 970, 'name': 'Dean Troyer', 'email': 'dtroyer@gmail.com', 'username': 'dtroyer'}, {'_account_id': 1669, 'name': 'Julien Danjou', 'display_name': 'jd', 'email': 'julien@danjou.info', 'username': 'jdanjou'}, {'_account_id': 2472, 'name': 'Doug Hellmann', 'email': 'dhellmann@redhat.com', 'username': 'doug-hellmann'}, {'_account_id': 2750, 'name': 'Sean Dague', 'email': 'sean@dague.net', 'username': 'sdague'}, {'_account_id': 2813, 'name': 'Mehdi Abaakouk', 'email': 'sileht@sileht.net', 'username': 'sileht'}, {'_account_id': 5263, 'name': 'Jeremy Stanley', 'display_name': 'fungi', 'email': 'fungi@yuggoth.org', 'username': 'fungi', 'status': 'missing, presumed fed'}, {'_account_id': 7450, 'name': 'Yassine Lamgarchal', 'email': 'yassine.lamgarchal@redhat.com', 'username': 'yassine.lamgarchal'}, {'_account_id': 8122, 'name': 'Cyril Roelandt', 'email': 'cyril@redhat.com', 'username': 'cyril.roelandt.enovance'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-02 16:07:01.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'force run_process to really spawn a bash process

Before this change ceilometer process are killed by stack.sh in gate

gate use 'USE_SCREEN=False' for devstack, this run service process in
some bash subshell instead of a screen.

The ceilometer service process are started directly without embeded shell
command: 'screen_it ceilometer-api "ceilometer-api -d -v ..."',
and this have as effect to not add a additionnal bash (subshell) process between
the stack.sh process and the ceilometer process.

And when stack.sh kill all directly attached process (clean function),
it kill the with ceilometer one too.

This is because the 'bash -c "only_one_command"' use exec to start the command
and does not execute the command as a bash script.

This patch add 'true;' to the service command to be sure that bash don't exec the
command passed to '-c' but execute it as a shell script.

Fixes bug #1234254

Change-Id: I965506d9105608c936bcbcb5913d1e154bedaad3

This is because the 'bash -c "only_one_command"' use exec to start the command
and does not execute the command as a bash script.

This patch use "{ $command ; }" to be sure that bash don't exec the command
passed to '-c' but execute it as a shell script.

Fixes bug #1234254

Change-Id: I965506d9105608c936bcbcb5913d1e154bedaad3

commit_message:
force run_process to really spawn a bash process

Before this change ceilometer/sar process are killed by stack.sh in gate

gate use 'USE_SCREEN=False' for devstack, this run service process in
some bash subshell instead of a screen.

The ceilometer service or the sar command are started directly without embeded shell
command: 'screen_it ceilometer-api "ceilometer-api -d -v ..."',
and this have as effect to not add a additionnal bash (subshell) process between
the stack.sh process and the ceilometer/sar process.

And when stack.sh kill all directly attached process (clean function),
it kill the with ceilometer and sar too.

This is because the 'bash -c "only_one_command"' use exec to start the command
and does not execute the command as a bash script.

This patch use "{ $command ; }" to be sure that bash don't exec the command
passed to '-c' but execute it as a shell script.

Fixes bug #1234254
Fixes bug #1238482

Change-Id: I965506d9105608c936bcbcb5913d1e154bedaad3

subject: Convert str passed as Numbers/Integer to numbers
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-18 02:29:21.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/test_autoscaling.py', 'heat/tests/test_properties.py', 'heat/engine/properties.py', 'heat/tests/test_volume.py'], 'message': "Convert str passed as Numbers/Integer to numbers

Previously, if a number-in-a-string was passed as a Number or Integer
property, it would be validated as correct but not be converted to
an integer (it's clear that the code intended to do this but had a trivial
bug).

Unfortunately, making this change causes some backwards incompatibility.

- Previously, an AllowedValues field could have strings in it, e.g.
  ['1', '3', '5'], and this would work if a string was passed as the
  real value.
- Resource code that relied on users accidentally passing strings
  instead of numbers will now break, since it will actually be
  receiving real numbers.

You can see evidence of this in the tests I had to update
elsewhere. I don't believe any existing Heat resources are affected
by this, but it is possible that there are some templates out there
that will break.

Change-Id: I879545cae5ca52f485803a8e172c5484f3920b67
Closes-bug: #1241276
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Convert str passed as Numbers/Integer to numbers

Previously, if a number-in-a-string was passed as a Number or Integer
property, it would be validated as correct but not be converted to
an integer (it's clear that the code intended to do this but had a trivial
bug).

Unfortunately, making this change causes some backwards incompatibility.

- Previously, an AllowedValues field could have strings in it, e.g.
  ['1', '3', '5'], and this would work if a string was passed as the
  real value.
- Resource code that relied on users accidentally passing strings
  instead of numbers will now break, since it will actually be
  receiving real numbers.

You can see evidence of this in the tests I had to update
elsewhere. I don't believe any existing Heat resources are affected
by this, but it is possible that there are some templates out there
that will break.

Change-Id: I879545cae5ca52f485803a8e172c5484f3920b67
Closes-bug: #1241276

commit_message:
Fixes generating of toci_env

if toci_functions.sh file is sourced then "-e 'CLOUD_ADMIN_PASSWORD'"
expression matches the "declare | ..." line in get_tocienv function.
Then this line is written into toci_env too, which causes that if
toci_env file is sourced it's emptied.

Change-Id: I91a748e762f769975e79f35c89e390270722afa1

commit_message:
Stop using openstack.common.exception

The openstack.common.exception has been deprecated and removed from
oslo-incubator. Therefore, Heat should follow the recommendation and
stop the usage of this file altogether.

Change-Id: I0364da262d956cecea7b77ebc40ead8ece224828
Closes-Bug: #1208734

Update openstack.common.db

This updates the openstack.common.db part of Oslo so it stops using
openstack.common.exception. The openstack.common.exception is now
deprecated and has been removed from oslo-incubator.

subject: Changes FakeMemcache to set token to expire on utcnow + 5 mins
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 18:30:09.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Changes FakeMemcache to set token to expire on utcnow + 5 mins

keystoneclient 0.4 will use utcnow to compare expiration date.
The FakMemcache class sets expiration to datetime.now which sets
date for local timezone. If this timezone happens to be behind
utc the test will fail with expiration error because we are
comparing utc + 5 mins with utc - 1 or more hours.

', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Changes FakeMemcache to set token to expire on utcnow + 5 mins

fixes bug 1240994

keystoneclient 0.4 will use utcnow to compare expiration date.
The FakMemcache class sets expiration to datetime.now which sets
date for local timezone. If this timezone happens to be behind
utc the test will fail with expiration error because we are
comparing utc + 5 mins with utc - 1 or more hours.

Change-Id: I551506a5aaf0aef77476b11786399a66225603bf

commit_message:
Move fixtures from test-requirments to requirments

Fixtures are required by oslo.lockutils so we should move them to
requirments.

And could move it back after this patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52612/
Will be merged

Change-Id: I018a603c994cf8573020cca28b77fa5716038d8e
Closes-bug: #1241581

commit_message:
avoid changing the rule's own action

fixes Bug #1240812

When iterating through the rule list, we should not change the rule itself.
So that we can use the rule data for the second router.

Change-Id: I613438507949007bec41416e7f8530693e4d5129

subject: Ignore basename failures
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 1726, 'name': 'Ghe Rivero', 'email': 'ghe.rivero@gmail.com', 'username': 'ghe.rivero'}, {'_account_id': 1926, 'name': 'Derek Higgins', 'email': 'derekh@redhat.com', 'username': 'derekh'}, {'_account_id': 6449, 'name': 'Chris Jones', 'email': 'cmsj@tenshu.net', 'username': 'cmsj'}, {'_account_id': 6773, 'name': 'Lucas Alvares Gomes', 'email': 'lucasagomes@gmail.com', 'username': 'lucasagomes'}, {'_account_id': 6849, 'name': 'Roman Podoliaka', 'email': 'roman.podoliaka@gmail.com', 'username': 'rpodolyaka'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 22:37:27.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-get-kernel'], 'message': "Ignore basename failures

Commit 0210be22aebffc715103767922b431953f3693e1 introduced the
possibility of basename being called on an empty string.  Because
that can happen in normal operation (such as an x86_64 kernel,
in which case the PAE check will find nothing), don't allow the
basename error to kill the script.  Also ignore failures in the
second basename call so the proper error message is echoed.

Change-Id: I38a18af09ab24fda9c98cbf3ace8fd7acc6faef5
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Ignore basename failures

Commit 0210be22aebffc715103767922b431953f3693e1 introduced the
possibility of basename being called on an empty string.  Because
that can happen in normal operation (such as an x86_64 kernel,
in which case the PAE check will find nothing), don't allow the
basename error to kill the script.  Also ignore failures in the
second basename call so the proper error message is echoed.

Change-Id: I38a18af09ab24fda9c98cbf3ace8fd7acc6faef5

Heat uses requests in a few places and is currently relying on the
