commit_message:
Add requests library to requirements.txt

Heat uses requests in a few places and is currently relying on the
python-*client dependencies to pull it in.  If the python-*client deps
stopped using requests, Heat would break.

Change-Id: Id1a0717836d2441dda33adfda3092d3004265f4a

subject: Avoid implying DevStack is POSIX-compatible
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-04 22:19:17.000000000', 'files': ['HACKING.rst'], 'message': "Avoid implying DevStack is POSIX-compatible

DevStack makes extensive use of some of Bash's non-POSIX extensions to
POSIX shell functionality (e.g. [[ ... ]] conditionals), and hence does
not run under stricter POSIX shells such as dash.

Change-Id: I998fa96c87b6a5f9e7ee1b41a57d097a16937ce0
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Avoid implying DevStack is POSIX-compatible

DevStack makes extensive use of some of Bash's non-POSIX extensions to
POSIX shell functionality (e.g. [[ ... ]] conditionals), and hence does
not run under stricter POSIX shells such as dash.

Change-Id: I998fa96c87b6a5f9e7ee1b41a57d097a16937ce0

commit_message:
Improved requests to instance_faults table

When list of instances is generated data is taken from number of
tables, except instance_faults. But then this data is requested
using another round-trip to database with probably lengthy list
of ids.

It should be better to get all data at once by JOINing
instance_fault table.

Change-Id: I2a2e04cf4d1f28c4e2b83a8a909d1647ce5c6110

commit_message:
xenapi: migrate multiple ephemeral disks

Current migrate does not move ephemeral disks. This change allows those
disks to be moved. Note there could be several ephemeral disks in the
case where there are ephemeral disks that would be too big for a single
VHD file, or split up to improve performance.

This change disables the ability to resize ephemeral disks. A later
patch will look at enabling resize-up for ephemeral disks. Currently,
during resize, the ephemeral disks are just dropped and re-recreated.

Implements blueprint xenapi-migrate-ephemeral-disks
Change-Id: I8d7d84b54d2a876a510c442bb11a1c64c35feb00

subject: Fix wrong using of Metadata in 15,16 migrations
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-18 09:09:23.000000000', 'files': ['ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/migrate_repo/versions/016_simpler_alarm.py'], 'message': 'Fix wrong using of Metadata in 15,16 migrations

In up>down>up mode migrations are failing due to using of common MetaData.
It should be declared separatly for both of migration methods.

Change-Id: Ie707f23d874ae6125a43698f0f1f204b829a24e7
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix wrong using of Metadata in 15,16 migrations

In up>down>up mode migrations are failing due to using of common MetaData.
It should be declared separatly for both of migration methods.

Change-Id: Ie707f23d874ae6125a43698f0f1f204b829a24e7

commit_message:
api: update for WSME 0.5b6 compliance

This makes use of the mandatory option of WSME, that now works, to
remove some of our custom validation code. This is needed for new
versions of WSME that do more validation on their own.

Fixes-Bug: #1240741

complete seed/under/overcloud deployment mid-run, we have captured the
IPs that have successfully deployed, for debugging purposes.

The permissions fixup hack assumes that prettytable-0.7.2 is
installed. Since python-prettytable 0.6.1 is already installed
from install_prereqs.sh (via files/rpm/general) and pip_install
does not set --upgrade, that assumption is inaccurate.

Apply the permissions fix to a more inclusive shell glob so
as to not fail when attempting to chmod a non-existant file.

Change-Id: I50d3b29ff1e2e0c5451700adaa4a634cf70209fc
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
fixup_stuff.sh: don't break on prettytable perms fixup on RHEL

The permissions fixup hack assumes that prettytable-0.7.2 is
installed. Since python-prettytable 0.6.1 is already installed
from install_prereqs.sh (via files/rpm/general) and pip_install
does not set --upgrade, that assumption is inaccurate.

Apply the permissions fix to a more inclusive shell glob so
as to not fail when attempting to chmod a non-existant file.

Change-Id: I50d3b29ff1e2e0c5451700adaa4a634cf70209fc

subject: fixup_stuff.sh: un-break site package detection for Python 2.6
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-14 15:48:12.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fixup_stuff.sh: un-break site package detection for Python 2.6

SITE_DIRS relied on the availability of site.getsitepackages() which
is a Python 2.7 addition. Since Python 2.6 is the latest Python
available on RHEL/CentOS 6, this would break DevStack on that
platform.

* Put the site packages detection magic into a separate .py script
* Continue to use the site.getsitepackages() method but fall back to
  distutils.sysconfig if the former fails.
* Populate SITE_DIRS from an invocation of that script, rather than
  from inline Python.

Fixes bug 1239742.

Change-Id: Ifdf9af5afbc16214b9541b0a627cd933e63d4f82
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-14 16:00:34.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'fixup_stuff.sh: un-break site package detection for Python 2.6

SITE_DIRS relied on the availability of site.getsitepackages() which
is a Python 2.7 addition. Since Python 2.6 is the latest Python
available on RHEL/CentOS 6, this would break DevStack on that
platform.

* Put the site packages detection magic into a separate .py script
* Continue to use the site.getsitepackages() method but fall back to
  distutils.sysconfig if the former fails.
* Populate SITE_DIRS from an invocation of that script, rather than
  from inline Python.

Fixes bug 1239742.

Change-Id: Ifdf9af5afbc16214b9541b0a627cd933e63d4f82
', 'number': 2}, {'created': '2013-10-15 12:48:24.000000000', 'files': ['tools/site-dirs.py', 'tools/fixup_stuff.sh'], 'message': 'fixup_stuff.sh: un-break site package detection for Python 2.6

SITE_DIRS relied on the availability of site.getsitepackages() which
is a Python 2.7 addition. Since Python 2.6 is the latest Python
available on RHEL/CentOS 6, this would break DevStack on that
platform.

* Put the site packages detection magic into a separate .py script
* Continue to use the site.getsitepackages() method but fall back to
  distutils.sysconfig if the former fails.
  Inspired by:
  https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/topics/install/#s-installing-the-development-version-without-pip
* Populate SITE_DIRS from an invocation of that script, rather than
  from inline Python.

Fixes bug 1239742.

Change-Id: Ifdf9af5afbc16214b9541b0a627cd933e63d4f82
', 'number': 3}]
commit_message:
fixup_stuff.sh: un-break site package detection for Python 2.6

SITE_DIRS relied on the availability of site.getsitepackages() which
is a Python 2.7 addition. Since Python 2.6 is the latest Python
available on RHEL/CentOS 6, this would break DevStack on that
platform.

* Put the site packages detection magic into a separate .py script
* Continue to use the site.getsitepackages() method but fall back to
  distutils.sysconfig if the former fails.
  Inspired by:
  https://docs.djangoproject.com/en/dev/topics/install/#s-installing-the-development-version-without-pip
* Populate SITE_DIRS from an invocation of that script, rather than
  from inline Python.

Fixes bug 1239742.

Change-Id: Ifdf9af5afbc16214b9541b0a627cd933e63d4f82

commit_message:
Remove upper bound on six dependency version

The upper bound on the six dependency version conflicts with the
lower bound on the transitive six dependency pulled in via the
latest 0.4.1 keystoneclient.

(We also increase the lower bound on the WSME dependency version
to avoid a potential conflict between six 1.4.x and WSME 0.5b2)

Change-Id: I4f00ff756e80397b6c3829b482c3b074b47824df

commit_message:
Fix PRD-2303. Add deployemnt tag network_provider for nova tests

For now tests on verification of nova networking do not have deployment tags
So it returns 503 error on enviroment with neutron
In this patch I add deployment tags: nova_network to disabled tests
discovering for it on enviroment with neutron

Fix bug/PRD-203

Change-Id: I4cb6b89dc04055ca80fcf92f6db8428449010577

to be able to delete a non-default quota (absolute limit) for a tenant

commit_message:
Added support of per-tenant-user quotas

Added new keys '--user' in v1.shell to quota-show, quota-update.
Added command quota-delete, that provides ability for admins
to be able to delete a non-default quota (absolute limit) for a tenant
or user, so that tenant's quota will revert back to the configured default.
Added 'responce_key' parameter to Manager._update function
Added '--force' parameter to quota-update to support new functionality
on server
Fixes help output, when in 'manila help' was displayed only first
string of command documentation

Implement bp: user-quota-support

Change-Id: Ibfe9ccf83ea43d5af6652342f1fe6a88c78a0364

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-18 02:03:15.000000000', 'files': ['fuelweb_test/integration/base_node_test_case.py', 'fuelweb_test/integration/test_ceph.py'], 'message': 'system test for Ceph deployment and HA

 * 2 multi-node and 1 HA configuration is deployed with Ceph enabled
 * Ceph HA test simulates OSD and Monitor failures
 * prepare_environment() is extended to skip post-deploy snapshot

', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
system test for Ceph deployment and HA

 * 2 multi-node and 1 HA configuration is deployed with Ceph enabled
 * Ceph HA test simulates OSD and Monitor failures
 * prepare_environment() is extended to skip post-deploy snapshot
   (clock skew introduced by snapshotting the env breaks Ceph cluster)

Change-Id: Id78ba3911d2cbbafbac9ac1414083e32a7a22639

commit_message:
server status remained in unexpected state

Two test case in the test_servers_negative change the 'one' servers
into a stable not active state. We are waiting 2 times 400 sec for
getting active state in vain.
Having those test cases to restore the expected state.

The deleted server related rebuild and reboot test case create are
merged and it creates and deletes one server.

Change-Id: Ie1b9dc62bad2bf7b8595da2c9d6f994c646a0025

commit_message:
Fix From/To Port In Cereating Security Group Rule

    Security Group Rule from/to port should be honored.
    The default policie is using the options defined in trove.conf
    not specified by the user.

Fixes Bug 1235858

Change-Id: I8f43218a4185c494a3219389b08958f087648da9

commit_message:
baremetal: Allow BM_SECOND_MAC to be unset

Currently DevStack registers the second nic of the baremetal
node even if BM_SECOND_MAC is not set or empty. However
an interface with an empty mac address causes dhcp to fail
(bug 1238595). And such operation will get to return a error
after the bug is resolved. So we should not register the
second nic if BM_SECOND_MAC is not set.

Related-Bug: #1238595
Change-Id: Ib3cc77686b72311403ccacbd70ae9cf43e6eb4c9

subject: Nicira plugin: do not die if NVP gateway IP is missing
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-19 16:20:56.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Nicira plugin: do not die if NVP gateway IP is missing

Devstack should not die if the parameters for establishing a
management connection to the NVP gateway appliance are not
provided, as this is not critical for devstack itself, and
also the user might have already configured connectivity
outside of devstack.

This patch also avoid using $PUBLIC_BRIDGE to this aim.
With the nicira plugin, this bridge is created only if
Q_USE_DEBUG_COMMAND is enabled; this is not a requirement for
running devstack unless one wants to run exercises.

Bug #1227750

commit_message:
Nicira plugin: do not die if NVP gateway IP is missing

Devstack should not die if the IP and prefix len for establishing
a connection to the public network are not provided.
In this case, the public gateway IP address used to configure
Neutron's public network should be used, together with the prefix
length of the public network's CIDR.

This patch also ensures $PUBLIC_BRIDGE is created, even if
Q_USE_DEBUG_COMMAND is disabled. Finally this patch also adds
the teardown operation for restoring the original IP addresses
on the interface used for connectivity to the public network
implemented on the NVP gateway.

Bug #1227750

Change-Id: Ib58738a578c46f2183d503cabfdc6039bfbeb702

commit_message:
Set wsgi logger to use __name__

Although underneath this is the eventlet.wsgi.server server, Other
OpenStack projects, don't use that logger instead they use there own.

This will also mean the wsgi server will stop logging on just the
warning level.  We want wsgi server to at least log on info level
so it will log when a request is processed and what the return code is.

Change-Id: I96fd73b84b4550f85ad96030fea815376901813a

commit_message:
Use Cloud Archive for Ubuntu MongoDB install

The Havana Cloud Archive
includes MongoDB 2.4.6 which is the latest stable point release for
MongoDB. This patch updates to use that instead of adding an
addition repository.

Change-Id: Ie89fee2a78824331761fded5b16d7cac022f736d

API (see https://review.openstack.org/30051), refactor DiskFile to
create a DiskReader class (akin to the DiskWriter class) which will
allow us to encapsulate file reading implementation details.

 * Refactor DiskWriter to reference threadpool via disk_file field
 * Misc exception syntax use of "as"

', 'number': 6}, {'created': '2013-07-31 02:32:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor DiskFile to add open ctx mgr and a "reader"

Ahead of the DiskFile refactoring work for a defined (yet internal)
API (see https://review.openstack.org/30051), refactor DiskFile to
create a DiskReader class for hold the WSGI "app iter" behaviors (akin
to the DiskWriter class, but not a context manager), encapsulating all
the file reading implementation details, a DiskFileOpened class to
bridge the five uses of the DiskFile object. We also push the notion
of tombstones down into the DiskFileWriter class replacing the
"put_metadata / unlinkold" sequence with a simple "delete" method.

In order to accomplish this, we also refactored the quarantine code to
remove the get_data_file_size method, recognizing that it was always
called immediately following the DiskFile contructed object. Now that
the DiskFile object has an open method, we fold the existence check
behavior into that method which now raises proper exceptions for those
conditions. Now all quarantine behaviors are performed on open()s, and
the new reader class records if the object ended up being quarantined,
and why.

Also:
 * Refactor DiskWriter to reference threadpool via disk_file field
 * Added a replicator support so that REST API code has no direct
   knowledge of DiskFile internals
 * Misc exception syntax use of "as"
 * Lots of test refactoring as well

Change-Id: Iefbbe7aada972b1ff2fc9fd5492646ab01fa192c
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
', 'number': 7}, {'created': '2013-08-26 19:22:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor DiskFile to add open ctx mgr and a "reader"

Ahead of the DiskFile refactoring work for a defined (yet internal)
API (see https://review.openstack.org/30051), refactor DiskFile to
create a DiskReader class for hold the WSGI "app iter" behaviors (akin
to the DiskWriter class, but not a context manager), encapsulating all
the file reading implementation details, a DiskFileOpened class to
bridge the five uses of the DiskFile object. We also push the notion
of tombstones down into the DiskFileWriter class replacing the
"put_metadata / unlinkold" sequence with a simple "delete" method.

In order to accomplish this, we also refactored the quarantine code to
remove the get_data_file_size method, recognizing that it was always
called immediately following the DiskFile contructed object. Now that
the DiskFile object has an open method, we fold the existence check
behavior into that method which now raises proper exceptions for those
conditions. Now all quarantine behaviors are performed on open()s, and
the new reader class records if the object ended up being quarantined,
and why.

Also:
 * Refactor DiskWriter to reference threadpool via disk_file field
 * Added a replicator support so that REST API code has no direct
   knowledge of DiskFile internals
 * Misc exception syntax use of "as"
 * Lots of test refactoring as well

Possible refactorings to pull out:
 * Metadata timestamps are now checked against the file name and if
   they don't match, object is quarantined
 * Unit test for DELETE refactored to be more explicit to help debug
   when it does not work

Change-Id: Iefbbe7aada972b1ff2fc9fd5492646ab01fa192c
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

conditions. Now all quarantine behaviors are performed on open()s, and
the new reader class records if the object ended up being quarantined,
and why.

Also:
 * Refactor DiskWriter to reference threadpool via disk_file field
 * Added a replicator support so that REST API code has no direct
   knowledge of DiskFile internals
 * Misc exception syntax use of "as"
 * Lots of test refactoring as well

Possible refactorings to pull out:
 * Metadata timestamps are now checked against the file name and if
   they don't match, object is quarantined
 * Unit test for DELETE refactored to be more explicit to help debug
   when it does not work

Change-Id: Iefbbe7aada972b1ff2fc9fd5492646ab01fa192c
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
', 'number': 10}, {'created': '2013-09-06 23:01:03.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor DiskFile to add open ctx mgr and a "reader"

** Need to update this commit message still, sorry! **

Ahead of the DiskFile refactoring work for a defined (yet internal)
API (see https://review.openstack.org/30051), refactor DiskFile to
create a DiskReader class for hold the WSGI "app iter" behaviors (akin
to the DiskWriter class, but not a context manager), encapsulating all
the file reading implementation details, a DiskFileOpened class to
bridge the five uses of the DiskFile object. We also push the notion
of tombstones down into the DiskFileWriter class replacing the
"put_metadata / unlinkold" sequence with a simple "delete" method.

In order to accomplish this, we also refactored the quarantine code to
remove the get_data_file_size method, recognizing that it was always
called immediately following the DiskFile contructed object. Now that
the DiskFile object has an open method, we fold the existence check
behavior into that method which now raises proper exceptions for those
conditions. Now all quarantine behaviors are performed on open()s, and
the new reader class records if the object ended up being quarantined,
and why.

Also:
 * Refactor DiskWriter to reference threadpool via disk_file field
 * Added a replicator support so that REST API code has no direct
   knowledge of DiskFile internals
 * Misc exception syntax use of "as"
 * Lots of test refactoring as well

Possible refactorings to pull out:
 * Unit test for DELETE refactored to be more explicit to help debug
   when it does not work

Change-Id: Iefbbe7aada972b1ff2fc9fd5492646ab01fa192c
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>
', 'number': 11}, {'created': '2013-09-07 03:28:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor DiskFile adding Open and Reader classes

This set of refactorings is proposed as the last step before
officiallly declaring the DiskFile class, and its helpers, to be the
backend API servicing the Object Server REST API implementation code.

The goal of this work is to ensure that the REST API layer in the
object server does not have any access to internal knowledge of how
the DiskFile class is implemented.

Here is a short summarize set of changes made, followed by method and
attribute comparison chart for the changes:

  1. The DiskFile class is now a generic on-disk class that is
     expanded to cover the needs of the REPLICATE method, moving much
     of its original attributes to the new DiskFileOpened class

     a. Add an open() method encapsulate what it means to access an
        object to read its data and/or metadata

        See also https://review.openstack.org/44570 ("Remove
        keep_data_fp argument from DiskFile constructor")

     b. Add the replicator() method for servicing the REPLICATE API

     c. The account, container and object name parts are now passed as
        arguments to the main DiskFile methods

     d. Two helper methods are also added to encapsulate common
        patterns, .read_metadata(), .write_metadata()

  2. The new open() method constructs a new object, DiskFileOpened

     It encapsulates much of the state of DiskFile. It provides two
     methods, get_metadata() and reader(). The first provides access
     to the on-disk system and user metadata stored with the
     object. The second generates an object that tracks the reading
     state for a WSGI context, a DiskFileReader().

     a. Quarantining now occurs entirely internal to DiskFile objects,
        where only the "was_quarantined" attribute is provided for the
        object auditor (see the note below), the REST API layer is no
        longer responsible for issuing a quarantine operation

        The use of get_data_file_size() to fetch the actual size of
        the file, and trigger a quarantine event if the data does not
        match is subsumed by the open() method

     b. The is_deleted and is_expired methods are replaced with
        exceptions raised by the open() method

  3. The DiskFileReader() class provides the interface expected the
     WSGI environment for providing the response body of a GET outside
     of the object server REST API context

(as of master 8a255a3 Merge
 "Refactor finalize_put as an    This Commit
 object method")
--------------------------------+------------------------------------
DiskFile(a,c,o,keep_data_fp=)    DiskFile()

  Methods:                         Methods:
   *.__iter__()
    .close(verify_file=)
    .is_deleted()
    .is_expired()
    .quarantine()
    .get_data_file_size()
                                     .open(a,c,o)
                                     .read_metadata(a,c,o)
    .create()                        .create(a,c,o)
                                     .write_metadata(a,c,o)
    .delete()                        .delete(a,c,o)
                                     .replicator()

  Attributes:                      Attributes:
    .quarantined_dir
    .keep_cache
    .metadata

                                 DiskFileOpened()

                                   Methods:
                                     .get_metadata()
                                     .reader()

                                   Attributes:

                                *DiskFileReader()

                                   Methods:
                                     .__iter__()
                                     .close()

                                   Attributes:
                                    +.was_quarantined

DiskWriter()                     DiskFileWriter()

  Methods:                         Methods:
    .write()                         .write()
    .put()                           .put()

* Note that the DiskFile class   * Note that the DiskReader() object
  implements all the methods       returned by the
  necessary for a WSGI app         DiskFileOpened.reader() method
  iterator                         implements all the methods
                                   necessary for a WSGI app iterator

                                 + Note that if the auditor is
                                   refactored to not use the DiskFile
                                   class, see
                                   https://review.openstack.org/44787
                                   then we don't need the
                                   was_quarantined attribute

Change-Id: Iefbbe7aada972b1ff2fc9fd5492646ab01fa192c
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

', 'number': 15}, {'created': '2013-09-17 18:44:36.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Refactor DiskFile hiding quarantine adding reader

This set of refactorings is proposed as the last step before
officiallly declaring the DiskFile class, and its helpers, to be the
backend API servicing the Object Server REST API implementation code.
The goal is to ensure that the REST API layer in the object server
does not have any access to internal knowledge of how the DiskFile
class is implemented.

We hide the need for the REST API layer to know how and where
quarantining needs to be performed. There are now two places it is
checked internally, on open() where we verify the content-length,
name, and x-timestamp metadata, and in the reader on close where the
etag metadata is checked if the entire file was read.

We add a reader class to allow implementations to isolate the WSGI
handling code for that specific environment (it is used no-where else
in the REST APIs). This simplifies the caller's code to just use a
"with" statement once open to avoid multiple points where close needs
to be called.

For a full historical comparison, including the usage patterns see:
https://gist.github.com/portante/5488238

(as of master 8a255a3 Merge
 "Refactor finalize_put as an    This Commit
 object method")
--------------------------------+------------------------------------
                                 DiskFileManager(conf)

                                   Methods:
                                     .pickle_async_update()
                                     .get_diskfile()
                                     .get_hashes()

                                   Attributes:
                                     .devices
                                     .logger
                                     .disk_chunk_size
                                     .keep_cache_size
                                     .bytes_per_sync

DiskFile(a,c,o,keep_data_fp=)    DiskFile(a,c,o)

  Methods:                         Methods:
   *.__iter__()
    .close(verify_file=)
    .is_deleted()
    .is_expired()
    .quarantine()
    .get_data_file_size()
                                     .open()
                                     .read_metadata()
    .create()                        .create()
                                     .write_metadata()
    .delete()                        .delete()

  Attributes:                      Attributes:
    .quarantined_dir
    .keep_cache
    .metadata
                                *DiskFileReader()

                                   Methods:
                                     .__iter__()
                                     .close()

                                   Attributes:
                                    +.was_quarantined

DiskWriter()                     DiskFileWriter()

  Methods:                         Methods:
    .write()                         .write()
    .put()                           .put()

* Note that the DiskFile class   * Note that the DiskReader() object
  implements all the methods       returned by the
  necessary for a WSGI app         DiskFileOpened.reader() method
  iterator                         implements all the methods
                                   necessary for a WSGI app iterator

                                 + Note that if the auditor is
                                   refactored to not use the DiskFile
                                   class, see
                                   https://review.openstack.org/44787
                                   then we don't need the
                                   was_quarantined attribute

Change-Id: Iefbbe7aada972b1ff2fc9fd5492646ab01fa192c
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

commit_message:
Refactor DiskFile hiding quarantine adding reader

This set of refactorings is proposed as the last step before
officiallly declaring the DiskFile class, and its helpers, to be the
backend API servicing the Object Server REST API implementation code.
The goal is to ensure that the REST API layer in the object server
does not have any access to internal knowledge of how the DiskFile
class is implemented.

We hide the need for the REST API layer to know how and where
quarantining needs to be performed. There are now two places it is
checked internally, on open() where we verify the content-length,
name, and x-timestamp metadata, and in the reader on close where the
etag metadata is checked if the entire file was read.

We add a reader class to allow implementations to isolate the WSGI
handling code for that specific environment (it is used no-where else
in the REST APIs). This simplifies the caller's code to just use a
"with" statement once open to avoid multiple points where close needs
to be called.

For a full historical comparison, including the usage patterns see:
https://gist.github.com/portante/5488238

(as of master 8a255a3 Merge
 "Refactor finalize_put as an    This Commit
 object method")
--------------------------------+------------------------------------
                                 DiskFileManager(conf)

                                   Methods:
                                     .pickle_async_update()
                                     .get_diskfile()
                                     .get_hashes()

                                   Attributes:
                                     .devices
                                     .logger
                                     .disk_chunk_size
                                     .keep_cache_size
                                     .bytes_per_sync

DiskFile(a,c,o,keep_data_fp=)    DiskFile(a,c,o)

  Methods:                         Methods:
   *.__iter__()
    .close(verify_file=)
    .is_deleted()
    .is_expired()
    .quarantine()
    .get_data_file_size()
                                     .open()
                                     .read_metadata()
    .create()                        .create()
                                     .write_metadata()
    .delete()                        .delete()

  Attributes:                      Attributes:
    .quarantined_dir
    .keep_cache
    .metadata
                                *DiskFileReader()

                                   Methods:
                                     .__iter__()
                                     .close()

                                   Attributes:
                                    +.was_quarantined

DiskWriter()                     DiskFileWriter()

  Methods:                         Methods:
    .write()                         .write()
    .put()                           .put()

* Note that the DiskFile class   * Note that the DiskReader() object
  implements all the methods       returned by the
  necessary for a WSGI app         DiskFileOpened.reader() method
  iterator                         implements all the methods
                                   necessary for a WSGI app iterator

                                 + Note that if the auditor is
                                   refactored to not use the DiskFile
                                   class, see
                                   https://review.openstack.org/44787
                                   then we don't need the
                                   was_quarantined attribute

Change-Id: Iefbbe7aada972b1ff2fc9fd5492646ab01fa192c
Signed-off-by: Peter Portante <peter.portante@redhat.com>

[{'created': '2013-08-20 08:28:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Allow keeping of existing loggers with fileConfig

Currently, common.log.py setup() will disable all existing
loggers that were set up before importing a custom logging
configuration from file. This results in a lot of modules
not having any logging feeding into the root logger that
is overriden to redirect log output in the custom setup.

This change adds a config flag to allow users to change this
behavior and keep the existing loggers so they will be properly
redirected to some output mechanism specified in the user config.

commit_message:
Allow keeping of existing loggers with fileConfig

Currently, common.log.py setup() will disable all existing
loggers that were set up before importing a custom logging
configuration from file. This results in a lot of modules
not having any logging feeding into the root logger that
is overriden to redirect log output in the custom setup.

This change adds a config flag to allow users to change this
behavior and keep the existing loggers so they will be properly
redirected to some output mechanism specified in the user config.

fixes bug 1169328

Change-Id: I1f25300d44b04ca5bcdd9b505319f0d089a9c965

subject: Fix NovaObject versioning attribute usage
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 16:49:05.000000000', 'files': ['nova/objects/base.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_instance.py', 'nova/tests/objects/test_objects.py'], 'message': "Fix NovaObject versioning attribute usage

A typo made early in the object prototyping process has meant that
all objects thus far have been exposing a version of '1.0' because
the base object has been using an attribute of 'version'. The
object implementations have been exposing a 'VERSION' attribute
with their desired version advertisement.

Since we are still relatively early in the process of deploying
objects, the impact from this should be relatively minor, although
it is important to get this fixed ASAP before any incompatible
object changes are made.

(cherry picked from commit 99cbfb3492c80ded53fa018fe5a0881f977dc407)

Change-Id: If9154dc663111f304f72ef7f6f37c465e84ff504
Closes-bug: #1239709
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix NovaObject versioning attribute usage

A typo made early in the object prototyping process has meant that
all objects thus far have been exposing a version of '1.0' because
the base object has been using an attribute of 'version'. The
object implementations have been exposing a 'VERSION' attribute
with their desired version advertisement.

Since we are still relatively early in the process of deploying
objects, the impact from this should be relatively minor, although
it is important to get this fixed ASAP before any incompatible
object changes are made.

(cherry picked from commit 99cbfb3492c80ded53fa018fe5a0881f977dc407)

Change-Id: If9154dc663111f304f72ef7f6f37c465e84ff504
Closes-bug: #1239709

commit_message:
Fix L2pop to not send updates for unrelated networks

With this patch L2 population mechanism driver
sends updates only with ports related to the
network id of the port which is being updated.

Fixes bug: 1240744
Change-Id: If7d51ce26bf0d0837a00da07fe85f48d55e681c6

commit_message:
Update version aliases for rpc version control

Now that Havana has been branched, add aliases for the rpc version
implemented by Havana.  These aliases can be used in the configuration
options for doing outbound rpc version control.

This is one of the items that should be done after every release, and
has been added to the new release checklist wiki page:

    https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Nova/ReleaseChecklist

DocImpact - 'havana' is now a valid value to provide to all of the
options in the [upgrade_levels] section of nova.conf.

Change-Id: Ifa0b3dcc00843ad3f045a450ceb0f47f0b843f98

commit_message:
nvp:log only in rm router iface if port not found

The code currently raises when it's not able to find the port to be
deleted on the backend. This might happen, for instance, when the
port is manually removed or, in some cases, if port creation failed
in the first place.

There's little sense in raising when a resource to be removed is not
found; therefore this patch replaces the raise statement with a log
statement.

Bug 1240720

Change-Id: Ifa756b07ef41346a44325341c8e0e8994dc64dde

raw.read() is returning unprintable characters,
use the higher lawer "content" property.

Closes-bug: #1240289

subject: Small optimization to container_quotas
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-10 20:40:36.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/middleware/container_quotas.py'], 'message': "Small optimization to container_quotas

When handling an object PUT with X-Copy-From, we only need to fetch
the source object's size if the container has a byte quota, but we
were always fetching it. Now we only fetch the size when we need it.

Change-Id: I0c2c6820cdf0022ef57df5fe7dcb2dd466665a4f
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Small optimization to container_quotas

When handling an object PUT with X-Copy-From, we only need to fetch
the source object's size if the container has a byte quota, but we
were always fetching it. Now we only fetch the size when we need it.

Change-Id: I0c2c6820cdf0022ef57df5fe7dcb2dd466665a4f

Fixes pagination with non-string markers types.

not a string but a different type such as a date time.

Fixes bug 1240275

commit_message:
Replace mox with mox3

Mox3 is an unofficial port of the Google mox framework
(http://code.google.com/p/pymox/) to Python 3.
https://pypi.python.org/pypi/mox3

Align with global-requirement and update the importing clause.

Partial implement: blueprint py33-support

Change-Id: I5d46d30b72b8504977d8d1891b3b0c81714e9099

commit_message:
Make tuskar element supply tripleo-heat-templates

Tuskar API service requires tripleo-heat-templates on start,
so it's the task of tuskar image element to clone t-h-t git
repo and do a checkout of the given tag or commit id.

Blueprint: tripleo-heat-templates

Change-Id: Ife3ae07bc6ce43e4593b4874cd52be87c900166c

subject: Make Autoscaling update policy tests faster
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 09:49:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Make Autoscaling update policy tests faster

The tests for the update policy implementation in autoscaling and
instance group were relying on wallclock time, making them unusually
slow. This patch improves the situation a bit by stubing time calls.

Change-Id: I23ba12a4191595a398b06a3dd8d6de15721c9696
', 'number': 1}, {'created': '2013-10-17 12:44:40.000000000', 'files': ['heat/tests/common.py', 'heat/tests/test_autoscaling_update_policy.py', 'heat/tests/test_instance_group_update_policy.py'], 'message': 'Make Autoscaling update policy tests faster

The tests for the update policy implementation in autoscaling and
instance group were relying on wallclock time, making them unusually
slow. This patch improves the situation a bit by stubing time calls.

Change-Id: I23ba12a4191595a398b06a3dd8d6de15721c9696
', 'number': 2}]
commit_message:
Make Autoscaling update policy tests faster

The tests for the update policy implementation in autoscaling and
instance group were relying on wallclock time, making them unusually
slow. This patch improves the situation a bit by stubing time calls.

Change-Id: I23ba12a4191595a398b06a3dd8d6de15721c9696

commit_message:
Remove framebuffer video drivers from ramdisks.

We now forcibly remove all framebuffer video drivers from ramdisks, as
part of our ongoing effort to keep every kernel we boot, in text mode,
so it can be more easily intercepted by LOM hardware, nova console
logging, etc.

Fixes-Bug: #1178409

Change-Id: Ia72211c97c03c3f60eb9a1483297fe587de51f0b

subject: Remove a buggy method in sqlalchemy.api
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 08:24:58.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/api.py', 'heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py'], 'message': 'Remove a buggy method in sqlalchemy.api

watch_data_delete tries to retrieve session object from a result set instead of
managed objects. Further, from the name of the method, the intention seems to
remove watch data associated with a given watch rule, but it would actually
remove all watch_rules having the given watch_name. Though it would not succeed,
if there is any associated watch data.

Since this method is not referenced anywhere in the entire project, it might be
better to just remove it for now.

Change-Id: I7a66f336a2a33b4a941df85910f29c3cfb2c816f
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Remove a buggy method in sqlalchemy.api

watch_data_delete tries to retrieve session object from a result set instead of
managed objects. Further, from the name of the method, the intention seems to
remove watch data associated with a given watch rule, but it would actually
remove all watch_rules having the given watch_name. Though it would not succeed,
if there is any associated watch data.

Since this method is not referenced anywhere in the entire project, it might be
better to just remove it for now.

Change-Id: I7a66f336a2a33b4a941df85910f29c3cfb2c816f

[{'created': '2013-09-25 06:12:29.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Moved create_instance DNS attempt to post-prepare

Moved the actual attempt to add DNS to after the prepare call because of
two issues 1) instances that have failures on DNS end up in a condition
in which the container is unusable - there is no support to send a
prepare call otherwise and 2) DNS isn't required for any operations
after it's addition thus making it a gating operation for prepare makes
no sense because if there is a failed DNS request, retrying that
operation is much less complex than re-issuing a prepare call and
support teams can handle this by hand.

blueprint trove-taskmanager-send-prepare-before-dns

commit_message:
Moved create_instance DNS attempt to post-prepare

Moved the actual attempt to add DNS to after the prepare call because of
two issues 1) instances that have failures on DNS end up in a condition
in which the container is unusable - there is no support to send a
prepare call otherwise and 2) DNS isn't required for any operations
after it's addition thus making it a gating operation for prepare makes
no sense because if there is a failed DNS request, retrying that
operation is much less complex than re-issuing a prepare call and
support teams can handle this by hand.

blueprint trove-taskmanager-send-prepare-before-dns

Change-Id: I51fa2115e3d52a85aa87970903922f25bae3bf9f

commit_message:
Detect and process live-migration in Cisco plugin

With Cisco/Nexus plugin, migration is not fully supported. Logic to detect
port binding change needs to be added in update_port(), and provisioning of
nexus switch(es) should be done accordingly

added test code for update_port() in the model layer and the db layer

Closes-Bug: #1229217

Change-Id: I2bd76030711c9d15462e91da9e4c0836a424834f

commit_message:
Update six dependency

The version of six specified in nova's requirements list
conflicts with the version used by the python-keystoneclient
requirement. This change updates the settings for six so
they match.

Change-Id: I3082090f5d3849a7fbebf515c3d743cd8c3e9c43

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-09-26 20:23:35.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Add notifications for group, role and trust

Currently, we only issue notifications for projects, users and
domains. This patch will add support to issue notifications for
groups, roles and trusts. The notifications will be sent on
create, update and delete, except for trusts, which does not
perform update.

commit_message:
Add notifications for groups and roles

Currently, we only issue notifications for projects, users and
domains. This patch will add support to issue notifications for
groups and roles. Notifications will be sent on create, update
and delete.

I've also updated tests to include tests for projects and users.

DocImpact
Change-Id: I23eac9afb2a227e5739dc25395705597a92eb23c
fixes: bug 1231220

commit_message:
Call cleanup-env early in devtest

Calling this ensures VM's and storage from previous devtest runs are
destroyed and undefined. This can also be inhibited by setting
TRIPLEO_CLEANUP to 0 (on by default).

Change-Id: I5c11eb07803228d21ccbfd5c4d34128399824b8f

commit_message:
Remove legacy code from test engine

This patch removes the legacy code from Rally test engine according to the
recent changes in that part of the system (abandoning pytest in favor of a
self-written scenario runner).

Blueprint test-engine

Change-Id: Ifa3bd95393d0992e69a187b17895730965e60c43

commit_message:
Add debug logging showing what is flattened

To make it easier to debug what the flattening
process is doing add a decorator that shows the
result of the translation of tasks/flows into
graphs (and prints a useful summary of what is
in the graph after flattening).

Change-Id: I865bda00a0f192c2497cc35537d8ab654d6e8235

commit_message:
VMware: Added doc for VMware VMDK cinder driver

Added document describing configuration of the driver and supported operations
when using it for cinder volume management.

Updated volume section in doc/common/section_vmware.xml.

Change-Id: I1181f8c834c916ef241a5abdeb48ab85b778d8e7

commit_message:
Use py3kcompat.urlutils from oslo instead of six.urllib_parse

Six before 1.4.0 does not provide urllib_parse module, so we need
another solution.

Closes-bug: #1240827
Change-Id: I6b49b80b94028e01da0e3c4930f3e97cd32f73d0

commit_message:
Several stylistic fixes for tests related patch
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/52165/ .
* assign networks on interfaces only in case if node
  was added to cluster
* assigned networks should be only for one interface
* remove mac assignment in test, because
  it is done in _create_interfaces_from_meta

Change-Id: I8f34bc77ad450206d11fd4b7bff464d6f8c26f60

commit_message:
Prepares preface for O'Reilly early release

* Describes who the book is for
* Corrects authors job titles as needed
* Provides an introduction to OpenStack
* Gives an overview of the organization and what you get out of
  each chapter
* Fixes a typo in Tales appendix
* Removes "What's Next" as a separate chapter and puts it into
a note at the end of Architecture chapters

Change-Id: Ib1f2a4012d09a4d3ff7885c95bbf165f2ef6d30f

patch removes the use mox for ironicclient unit test cases.

commit_message:
Extend usage message for `swift download`

Make it clear that you do not have to provide either the container or
object positional parameters, and what swiftclient will do if you omit
them.

commit_message:
Using policies for protected properties

This patch extends the way we can define rules for property protections.
It allows us to use the roles/rules defined in policy.json and leverage
the policy language for property protections as well.

DocImpact

Related to bp api-v2-property-protection

Change-Id: I4789ebb2645171280185d2c76138e78d954b5954

subject: Fixes Hyper-V snapshot spawning issue
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 642, 'name': 'Matt Dietz', 'email': 'matthew.dietz@gmail.com', 'username': 'cerberus'}, {'_account_id': 2166, 'name': 'SmokeStack CI', 'username': 'smokestack', 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 3185, 'name': 'Alessandro Pilotti', 'email': 'apilotti@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'alexpilotti'}, {'_account_id': 4393, 'name': 'Dan Smith', 'email': 'dms@danplanet.com', 'username': 'danms'}, {'_account_id': 6873, 'name': 'Matt Riedemann', 'email': 'mriedem.os@gmail.com', 'username': 'mriedem'}, {'_account_id': 7040, 'name': 'GuoHui LIu', 'email': 'liuguohui@gmail.com', 'username': 'guohliu'}, {'_account_id': 8543, 'name': 'Lucian Petrut', 'email': 'lpetrut@cloudbasesolutions.com', 'username': 'plucian'}]
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-08 18:44:47.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': "Hyper-V snapshot spawning issue

In Hyper-V, snapshoting an instance and then spawning a new
one using the resulted snapshot image with the same flavor,
will result an Hyper-V Exception.

Hyper-V will get the request to resize the base image to it's
actual size, leading to an error.

The reason is that the logic of the resize_vhd method has been
changed, as it is meant to resize images to the flavor size minus
the image metadata size, thus it's maximum internal size. For this
reason, the way to decide whether the root image should be resized
or not must also be changed.

So, instead of comparing the root image and base image sizes,
we should compare their maximum internal sizes.

Fixes bug: #1234759

Change-Id: I83d2df76b726d705cedc52a8309a2be7037d6a79

commit_message:
Fixes Hyper-V snapshot spawning issue

In Hyper-V, snapshoting an instance and then spawning a new
one using the resulted snapshot image with the same flavor,
will result an Hyper-V Exception.

Hyper-V will get the request to resize the base image to it's
actual size, leading to an error.

The reason is that the logic of the resize_vhd method has been
changed, as it is meant to resize images to the flavor size minus
the image metadata size, thus it's maximum internal size. For this
reason, the way to decide whether the root image should be resized
or not must also be changed.

So, instead of comparing the root image and base image sizes,
we should compare their maximum internal sizes.

Closes-Bug: #1234759

Change-Id: I83d2df76b726d705cedc52a8309a2be7037d6a79

commit_message:
Add noqa support for H231 and H233

commit_message:
Revert "Adds ability to ignore hacking validations with noqa"

The allownoqa decorator caused hacking to not enforce any rule using
that decorator. This change can be seen in the number of unit tests that
are run, before this patch its 150 and after its 198

This reverts commit ce4f1f35c9465fc88e764527fc987328f66f7c89.

Fixes-bug: # 1231149

Conflicts:
	hacking/core.py

Change-Id: I90044710f72ff1ad0b49e95b7aae854af34a057a

commit_message:
optimize queries for image-list

- avoid full table scan on images table by converting,
images.is_public = 1 OR images.owner = 'OWNER'
to
query WHERE images.is_public = 1
UNION
query WHERE images.owner = 'OWNER'
- move image related conditions to the inner union queries
- remove unwanted union of queries in case of admin querying for image list
- change the condition images.status != 'killed' to images.status in ('active', 'saving', 'queued', 'pending_delete', 'deleted')
- convert the correlation subqueries that are used for image_property filters into inner joins

Fixes bug 1211315

depends on bug 1214830

Change-Id: Ie7458044edbe1ef64871bcf5ef4996ed3cc0f957

commit_message:
Source ~/.devtestrc early in devtest run

This will allow people to keep environment variables consistent over multiple
logins. e.g. Users will no longer need to set http_proxy or
OVERCLOUD_DIB_EXTRA_ARGS each time they login.

Change-Id: Ie067fa9fe7bc665bf59fbd08a1a2f345037ae8e6

subject: Fix Huawei drivers to support other host OSs
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 16:30:22.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_dorado.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_hvs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_huawei_t_dorado.py', 'cinder/tests/test_huawei_hvs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/rest_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_utils.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/ssh_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/__init__.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_t.py'], 'message': 'Fix Huawei drivers to support other host OSs

Huawei drivers create Linux hosts by default when attaching volumes.
This patch makes them also support Windows, XenServer, AIX, etc.
The default OS is still Linux if it is not specified.

Users need to configure the host OS types in Huawei XML configuration
file. They need to set the items like this:
<Host OSType="Windows" HostIP="10.10.0.1, 10.10.0.2, ..." />
<Host .../>

When attaching a volume, the driver will get the host IP from nova. We
compare that IP with the IP in "HostIP" to get the corresponding OS type.

Closes-bug: #1229759
Change-Id: I36fd52b97f790f1c68eaf24b6c12e7ef5d16145d
(cherry picked from I36fd52b97f790f1c68eaf24b6c12e7ef5d16145d)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix Huawei drivers to support other host OSs

Huawei drivers create Linux hosts by default when attaching volumes.
This patch makes them also support Windows, XenServer, AIX, etc.
The default OS is still Linux if it is not specified.

Users need to configure the host OS types in Huawei XML configuration
file. They need to set the items like this:
<Host OSType="Windows" HostIP="10.10.0.1, 10.10.0.2, ..." />
<Host .../>

When attaching a volume, the driver will get the host IP from nova. We
compare that IP with the IP in "HostIP" to get the corresponding OS type.

Closes-bug: #1229759
Change-Id: I36fd52b97f790f1c68eaf24b6c12e7ef5d16145d
(cherry picked from I36fd52b97f790f1c68eaf24b6c12e7ef5d16145d)

commit_message:
Dracut regenerate initrd w/ the right kernel

When picking the latest version of the kernel on i386 we should prioritize
PAE kernels. Debug kernels will be ignored.

Related-Bug: #1240873

subject: Fix huawei HVS driver QoS and Tier issues
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 14:19:43.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/rest_common.py'], 'message': 'Fix huawei HVS driver QoS and Tier issues

Huawei HVS driver supports QOS and Tier functions. User can
open those functions by setting volume type. QOS requires users
to set flow strategy and io priority. Tier requires user to set
distribution policy and transfer strategy.

The current driver limits the QOS strategy to be "Qos-high",
"Qos-normal" and "Qos-low" which is not direct, and just allows
user to set distribution policy: "Tier-high", "Tier-normal" and
"Tier-low".

This patch changes the keys of QOS and Tier and adds transfer
strategy for Tier. Also it checks QOS strategy status when adding
new lun to the strategy.

Closes-bug: #1237268
Change-Id: Ie65a5b9c909d7346e73cb3341f8a966685cc7beb
(cherry picked from commit Ib3daabc3a68da47d81b53857d3080158b5b574f4)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix huawei HVS driver QoS and Tier issues

Huawei HVS driver supports QOS and Tier functions. User can
open those functions by setting volume type. QOS requires users
to set flow strategy and io priority. Tier requires user to set
distribution policy and transfer strategy.

The current driver limits the QOS strategy to be "Qos-high",
"Qos-normal" and "Qos-low" which is not direct, and just allows
user to set distribution policy: "Tier-high", "Tier-normal" and
"Tier-low".

This patch changes the keys of QOS and Tier and adds transfer
strategy for Tier. Also it checks QOS strategy status when adding
new lun to the strategy.

Closes-bug: #1237268
Change-Id: Ie65a5b9c909d7346e73cb3341f8a966685cc7beb
(cherry picked from commit Ib3daabc3a68da47d81b53857d3080158b5b574f4)

subject: Fix Huawei drivers to support other host OSs
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-16 14:15:21.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_dorado.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_hvs.py', 'cinder/tests/test_huawei_t_dorado.py', 'cinder/tests/test_huawei_hvs.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/rest_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_utils.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/ssh_common.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/__init__.py', 'cinder/volume/drivers/huawei/huawei_t.py'], 'message': 'Fix Huawei drivers to support other host OSs

Huawei drivers create Linux hosts by default when attaching volumes.
This patch makes them also support Windows, XenServer, AIX, etc.
The default OS is still Linux if it is not specified.

Users need to configure the host OS types in Huawei XML configuration
file. They need to set the items like this:
<Host OSType="Windows" HostIP="10.10.0.1, 10.10.0.2, ..." />
<Host .../>

When attaching a volume, the driver will get the host IP from nova. We
compare that IP with the IP in "HostIP" to get the corresponding OS type.

Closes-bug: #1229759

Change-Id: I18356bd9b4167d1543ad65fa8d9bfd3329ca19b0
(cherry picked from commit I36fd52b97f790f1c68eaf24b6c12e7ef5d16145d)
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Fix Huawei drivers to support other host OSs

Huawei drivers create Linux hosts by default when attaching volumes.
This patch makes them also support Windows, XenServer, AIX, etc.
The default OS is still Linux if it is not specified.

Users need to configure the host OS types in Huawei XML configuration
file. They need to set the items like this:
<Host OSType="Windows" HostIP="10.10.0.1, 10.10.0.2, ..." />
<Host .../>

When attaching a volume, the driver will get the host IP from nova. We
compare that IP with the IP in "HostIP" to get the corresponding OS type.

Closes-bug: #1229759

Change-Id: I18356bd9b4167d1543ad65fa8d9bfd3329ca19b0
(cherry picked from commit I36fd52b97f790f1c68eaf24b6c12e7ef5d16145d)

commit_message:
Fix disk-image-get-kernel for redhat

disk-image-get-kernel picks the wrong version of kernel and initramfs
if there's a PAE and non-PAE version present. Only affects i386 images.

Change-Id: I06e08fdf038988759b620f549261499cb0a69b34
Closes-Bug: #1240873

commit_message:
Ensure override_time lookup does not run into trouble

use getattr for accessing utcnow.override_time (and default it to
None) to prevent us from running into AttributeError mentioned in
the bug report

Fixes LP #: 1222302

Change-Id: I3ebc1e38a06583d66df03a20b5c1d9f81ad0e010

To take account of the latest release:

  https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-ceilometerclient/1.0.6

Nothing too controversial in this release:

  $ git fetch ; git tag -n15 -l 1.0.6

  1.0.6           python-ceilometerclient 1.0.6

    Includes the following changes:

         * Add support for new alarm-history command
         * Use standard CLI object-verb ordering for alarm-{g|s}set-state
         * Fix shell.do_alarm_get_state to get as opposed to set
         * Updated from global requirements
         * Allow to update an alarm partially
         * Added support to --os-cacert
         * Help messages: specify which options are required
         * Improve the CM shell client alarm visualisation

Change-Id: Idc3aa76a59258ddc47a7fdbeea69a13cf0597b97
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Update python-ceilometerclient lower bound to 1.0.6

To take account of the latest release:

  https://pypi.python.org/pypi/python-ceilometerclient/1.0.6

Nothing too controversial in this release:

  $ git fetch ; git tag -n15 -l 1.0.6

  1.0.6           python-ceilometerclient 1.0.6

    Includes the following changes:

         * Add support for new alarm-history command
         * Use standard CLI object-verb ordering for alarm-{g|s}set-state
         * Fix shell.do_alarm_get_state to get as opposed to set
         * Updated from global requirements
         * Allow to update an alarm partially
         * Added support to --os-cacert
         * Help messages: specify which options are required
         * Improve the CM shell client alarm visualisation

Change-Id: Idc3aa76a59258ddc47a7fdbeea69a13cf0597b97

commit_message:
Validation for messages returned by queue/stats

This patch updates the  queue/stats tests to include validation for message age
(0 <= age <= message_ttl_max), href & created time.

Tests Bug: #1237620

Change-Id: I7c6dfd10b94c8ac64247d687ac31783522b8f3d0

commit_message:
Use static IP address instead of dhcp for admin network
* pass netcfg/choose_interface parameter for Ubuntu and Centos\RedHat
* pass to orchestrator static ip instead of dhcp for admin network
* fix ip order for admin ips, it was broken for deployment
  and provisioning assigned other ip addresses
* small stylistic refactoring of network manager
* fix test for capacity which some times fails

Change-Id: I8344a08bc7323cfb6ebc2c5f0dc113cc74fc62ef

subject: Return a consumer function instead of consuming
revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-14 08:25:44.000000000', 'files': [], 'message': 'Return a consumer function instead of consuming

Former implementation was called consume_for and used to consume the
whole pipeline. This implementation returns a callable function instead
which makes it possible for wrapped methods to have a `method` keyword
and to control / reuse the consumer.

Implements blueprint storage-pipeline

', 'number': 6}]
commit_message:
Return a consumer function instead of consuming

Former implementation was called consume_for and used to consume the
whole pipeline. This implementation returns a callable function instead
which makes it possible for wrapped methods to have a `method` keyword
and to control / reuse the consumer.

Implements blueprint storage-pipeline

Change-Id: I8d7ad43028b5615b24f06ca1e116e35e5ab6a145

commit_message:
fix missing host when unshelving

An instance has the hostname of the host on which it is running.
The hostname is deleted when shelving. However, the hostname is not
recreated when unshelving.

This patch sets the hostname when unshelving.

Change-Id: I2e431718198321c46b9335e6fb7ab7be3943fab6
Closes-Bug: #1237868

commit_message:
Fix cleaning up for testsets

Logic that controlls cleaning up for savanna/murano/heat components
(also body of _delete_it function) has been wrapped in try/except
block so that in now does't affect global process of cleaning.

commit_message:
Move negative action tests to right place

Negative tests of server should be written on test_servers_negative.py,
but some negative tests are written on positive tests file, then that
would mislead developers who add new negative tests.

This patch moves these negative tests to a right place.

Change-Id: If3ddb2a0a5d27a87d610c6d8e7783d400fd32606

[{'created': '2013-10-17 12:09:28.000000000', 'files': ['tools/conf/whitelist.txt', 'etc/savanna/savanna.conf.sample', 'tools/conf/extract_opts.py', 'tools/conf/blacklist.txt', 'tools/conf/generate_sample.sh', 'savanna/topology/topology_helper.py', 'etc/savanna/savanna.conf.sample-full', 'savanna/config.py'], 'message': 'Refreshed sample config files

Also adjusted config generator to work on master. To generate config, run
  tools/with_venv tools/conf/generate_sample.sh

Two files will be created:
etc/savanna/savanna.conf.sample.raw
etc/savanna/savanna.conf.sample-full

The former of them need to be manually changed to become
etc/savanna/savanna.conf.sample
(at least is lacks [plugin:...] sections)

The savanna.conf.sample-full is created by collecting all the configs
in the code except the ones listed in tools/conf/blacklist.txt

The savanna.conf.sample.raw is also created by collecting all the configs,
but only those listed in tools/conf/whitelist.txt are retained.

Change-Id: I56c009fd6ac1402622e1fee34bfabd8231c1ed6c
', 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Refreshed sample config files

Also adjusted config generator to work on master. To generate config, run
  tools/with_venv tools/conf/generate_sample.sh

Two files will be created:
etc/savanna/savanna.conf.sample.raw
etc/savanna/savanna.conf.sample-full

The former of them need to be manually changed to become
etc/savanna/savanna.conf.sample
(at least is lacks [plugin:...] sections)

The savanna.conf.sample-full is created by collecting all the configs
in the code except the ones listed in tools/conf/blacklist.txt

The savanna.conf.sample.raw is also created by collecting all the configs,
but only those listed in tools/conf/whitelist.txt are retained.

Change-Id: I56c009fd6ac1402622e1fee34bfabd8231c1ed6c

commit_message:
Skip negative compute quota tests that don't work with Neutron

Change I5187a109f0bacb1f3afa4276b3d73f47fd53ad87 re-enabled some
negative quota tests for compute but they don't work if you're using
Neutron due to nova bug 1186354.

There is a patch up for the bug here:

https://review.openstack.org/#/c/43822/

but it's taking awhile to land so we should skip the tests until that's
working.

Partial-Bug: #1186354

commit_message:
Use built-in print() instead of print statement

In python 3 print statement is not supported, so we should use
only print() functions.

Fixes bug 1226943

Change-Id: I0ae4cc7e5996ed30c69e153ba51438c56e56c09a

commit_message:
Use stevedore instead of importutils

Current `Pipeline` implementation uses importutils for loading stages.
This patch replaces the usage of importutils with stevedore so that it
is possible to have external stages as well.

Implements blueprint storage-pipeline

Change-Id: I3d1c48ddde0721db38f467f7b723d34ea2033b86

commit_message:
Adds router rules support to router details

Adds a table display and grid display for router
rules on the router details page. Changes router
details page to tab style page.

Implements: blueprint horizon-routerrules

Change-Id: I86d81db31f09e2a8d3b66a327fb9c1fb055e9d94

commit_message:
Added per user-tenant quota support

Added per user-tenant quota support.
Added user-quotas extension, that turns on user quota support if it is
loaded.
Added force parameter, that lets to ignore check if admin want to
force update when run 'manila quota-update'
Added 'extended-quotas' extension that has provides ability for admins
to be able to delete a non-default quota (absolute limit) for a
tenant, so that tenant's quota will revert back to the configured default,
and makes the force parameter always be passed if the client wants
to set the new quota lower than what is already used and reserved.
Added user quota support to db.api, sqlalchemy.api, sqlalchemy.models.
Added migrations for user quota support.

Implement bp: user-quota-support

Change-Id: Ifb8f8a041c2fa54e2ed3a8219e87607b161438ca

commit_message:
multiple CLI fixes

fixed progress bar error handling

added flag ordering message, ha_comapct removed

error for --env without id, network verification
error message for fuel node --upload/--download/--default without --disk/--network

added --force to cli node handler
node listing simplified

update environment creation
with gre and vlan network segment types

just one more changeset

commit_message:
Sync fixture module from oslo

Changes pulled:

  [f4a4855] Consolidate the use of stubs
  [6111131] Make openstack.common.fixture.config Py3 compliant

Due to the changes to the stub use, a couple of tests (the ones in
test_shelve) needed to have some cleanups removed that depended on some
stubs still being in place and not others. The normal DB cleanup
procedure handles this correctly, so the cleanups were superfluous
anyway.

The test in test_manager was split in two to avoid it resetting its
stubs halfway through. It was testing two separate scenarios anyway, so
it's the correct thing to do regardless.

I'll submit a patch later to get rid of all the superfluous VerifyAll
and UnsetStubs calls across the entire test suite, but for now, let's
just get the gate working again, shall we?

Fixes bug #1239898

Change-Id: I3aa4dfc0261a861e5eaa570849329292d64236ed

commit_message:
fix(queues): Global config used everywhere

This patch modifies the queues code to use manually instantiated configs
rather than the global config. This will allow for more flexibility in
configuring components. For example, the up-and-coming sharding feature
can construct configs based on the shard catalog rather than the local
INI file. Also, this change will make testing easier.

Also in this patch, the SQLite driver schema was consolidated into
one place in preparation for the sharding patch. With this change,
controllers can be instantiated and used independently, since all
the tables are set up when the driver is loaded, not in a piecemeal
fashion as before.

Change-Id: I1afa8ab8c7e6dd9a017f4a9e3a3b1fadbeb32806
Implements: blueprint remove-global-config
Closes-Bug: #1239725

revisions:
[{'created': '2013-10-17 10:01:44.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'ceilometer/tests/base.py', 'tests/db/test_migrations.py', 'tests/db/__init__.py', 'ceilometer/storage/sqlalchemy/models.py'], 'message': "Add test for checking models with migrations

Each component of OpenStack uses models as base for service
and migrations as base for creation of database.
In fact there are a lot of differences in models with migrations.

This patch adds opportunity to compare actual state of DB with models
in mysql and postgres dialects.

Will be checked:
- tables,
- columns (name, type, lenght, default, nullable),
- constraints (indexes, unique constraints and foreign keys).

Also there is a alembic support for project which use alembic repo
as base or auxiliary.
For each test it's own database will be used.
After ending all temporary databases will be removed.

bp: sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I415e11864a1859cf074e4e55eb610ae8ce96e8c5
", 'number': 1}]
commit_message:
Add test for checking models with migrations

Each component of OpenStack uses models as base for service
and migrations as base for creation of database.
In fact there are a lot of differences in models with migrations.
And there is no test that could find them.

This patch adds opportunity to compare actual state of DB with models
in mysql and postgres dialects.

Will be checked:
- tables,
- columns (name, type, lenght, default, nullable),
- constraints (indexes, unique constraints and foreign keys).

Also there is a alembic support for project which use alembic repo
as base or auxiliary.
For each test it's own database will be used.
After ending all temporary databases will be removed.

bp: sync-models-with-migrations

Change-Id: I415e11864a1859cf074e4e55eb610ae8ce96e8c5

commit_message:
Fixing ImagesOneServerTestXml issue

Now operations started with the server when it's task state was not
None. Ie. Idle / 'ready for action'.

The wait for wait_for_server_status method implicitly waits for the None
task state, it should be able to fix the issue.

The server will be rebuilded if otherwise it cannot be move to a clean active
state, this issue will be logged.
It is an unexpected exception, so the log verifier should be able to
report it.

Fixing bug 1218391

Change-Id: Ib0e90a06e0e34f134bcca74712939e87e235c1ea

commit_message:
Removes unnecessary api-paste.ini configuration

Paremeter api_paste_config defaults to '/etc/nova/api-paste.ini',
so it is not needed to set it in nova.conf. Without having the parameter
in nova.conf we can use this module together with dist.conf. Also
auth parameters should be in nova.conf and not in api-paste.ini.

Change-Id: I85e4626076429d3e6955b7578320aac1f40d056a

commit_message:
Fix NovaServers.snapshot benchmark

Do not suspend VM before snapshoting becase suspended
VMs cannot be snapshoted.

Change-Id: If399a6bae011e4c356381e815cd80b2bd2d009cc
Closes-bug: #1240851

commit_message:
Remove obsolete redhat-eventlet.patch

See I62ce43a330d7ae94eda4c7498782a655e63747fa for the gorey details on
why this exists.

As of this fix:

  https://github.com/eventlet/eventlet/pull/34

which was released in eventlet 0.13, we no longer need the patch.

This has now been removed from oslo-incubator, so this is really just
syncing that removal.

Change-Id: I84267f3c6726cb2e750f615e107c48b12c6ed353

commit_message:
Support for six < 1.4.0

Before 1.4.0 six did not have urllib_parse in six.moves. This commit
adds workaround for that.

Change-Id: Ied168eaa2601302b40193c7f6f3c83631656dd14
